headlines: Huge boost for the logistics sector: Windmill Capital
text: FM Nirmala Sitharaman stated that PM Gati Shakti is driven by roads, railways, airports, ports, mass transport, waterways, and logistics infrastructure. This lays focus on improving logistics and pushing economic growth, said Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd (a SEBI-registered research analyst- INH200007645). WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases on themes like logistics, transport, and more.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Bill Gates writes a book on how to make COVID-19 the last pandemic
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has written a book titled 'How to Prevent the Next Pandemic'. "I believe COVID-19 can be the last pandemic and my book explains why," Gates said. "Every time I read about the latest death toll or hear about someone who lost their job...I can't help but think: We don't have to do this again," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Glenmark launches anti-COVID-19 nasal spray that cuts 99% viral load in 48 hours
text: Glenmark Pharma, in partnership with Canada-based SaNOtize, has launched a nitric oxide nasal spray called FabiSpray in India for treating COVID-19 in adult patients who have high risk of progression of disease. The spray, used in the upper airways, reduced viral load of 94% in 24 hours and 99% in 48 hours during Phase 3 trial in India, Glenmark said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Joe Biden acknowledges Tesla as 'US' largest electric vehicle maker'; Musk responds
text: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday acknowledged Tesla as the country's "largest electric vehicle manufacturer", days after Elon Musk called him a "damp sock puppet in human form" for ignoring Tesla. A Twitter user said over 58,000 people signed a petition to ask Biden to "acknowledge Tesla's EV leadership". Responding to this, the billionaire said, "Thanks, this made a difference!"
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon more than doubles maximum base salary to $350,000 from $160,000 in US
text: Amazon is more than doubling the maximum base salary for its US-based technology and corporate employees to $350,000 from $160,000, according to a leaked internal memo seen by Bloomberg. "This past year has seen a particularly competitive labour market," the memo said. Amazon also said it was increasing overall compensation ranges for most jobs globally.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: $3.6 bn in stolen Bitcoin seized in US' biggest-ever financial seizure, couple arrested
text: The US Department of Justice seized over $3.6 billion in stolen Bitcoin in its largest financial seizure ever and arrested a couple in relation to it. The husband-wife allegedly conspired to launder cryptocurrency stolen during the 2016 hack of Bitfinex, a virtual currency exchange, presently valued at $4.5 billion. A hacker attacked Bitfinex and initiated over 2,000 unauthorised transactions.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla cannot have a market in India but jobs in China: Govt
text: Minister of Heavy Industries Krishan Pal Gurjar said there cannot be a situation where Tesla has a market in India but jobs are created in China. Stating that Tesla is yet to apply for schemes in India, he told the Lok Sabha, "Our policy is if a company wants to use Indian market, it has to provide jobs to Indians."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Regret hurt to sentiments: Suzuki Motor Corp on Pak dealerships' posts on Kashmir
text: Suzuki Motor Corporation issued a statement saying that it "deeply regrets the hurt to sentiments" caused by "insensitive communication" in the social media posts made by the company's dealers in Pakistan. The posts in question had expressed solidarity with Kashmiri separatists. "We don't align with any political or religious inclination in any part of the world," Suzuki Motor Corporation said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Any hurt caused is regretted: Honda apologises on Pak dealer's post on Kashmir
text: Honda Motor Company issued a statement over a social media post by the company's dealer in Pakistan that expressed solidarity with Kashmiri separatists. "Honda is...committed towards ensuring compliance with laws and sentiments of every country it operates in. Any hurt caused to this effect is regretted," it said. Kia India, Toyota, Suzuki and Hyundai also apologised for posts on Kashmir.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I understand, my firstborn died in my arms: Musk told father of Tesla crash victim
text: World's richest person Elon Musk emailed the father of a teen who died in a 2018 Tesla crash for weeks, court records show. Tesla CEO had asked James Riley if he'd like to talk, to which Riley said, "There's nothing worse than losing a child." "I understand...My firstborn son died in my arms. I felt his last heartbeat," Musk responded.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Hyundai, Kia recall 484,000 cars over fire risk, ask owners in US to park outside
text: Hyundai and its affiliate Kia have issued recalls for over 484,000 vehicles in the US over a potential fire risk in the engines and advised owners to park their cars outdoors and away from buildings. The companies said that an electrical component in their anti-lock brake systems could short circuit and cause a fire, even if the vehicles aren't running.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt's 'strong displeasure' on Hyundai Pak post expressed to S Korean ambassador: MEA
text: The MEA on Monday summoned the South Korean ambassador and expressed the government's "strong displeasure" over the "unacceptable" social media post by Hyundai Pakistan. MEA highlighted the matter concerned India's territorial integrity on which there could be no compromise. South Korean automaker Hyundai's Pakistan distributor expressed solidarity with Kashmiri separatists in a now-deleted post.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Domino's India apologises for Domino's Pakistan's posts on Kashmir; issues statement
text: Domino's India on Tuesday issued an apology after Domino's Pakistan's social media posts expressing solidarity with Kashmiri separatists surfaced on social media and raised boycott calls for the brand in India. "We regret and apologise for the unsolicited social media post published on Domino's social media handles outside the country," Domino's India said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bharti Airtel's board approves raising up to ₹7,500 crore in debt
text: Bharti Airtel's board has granted approval to raise up to ₹7,500 crore in debt, the company said in an exchange filing. The amount can be raised through the issuance of listed or unlisted non-convertible debt securities, including debentures and bonds, in one or more tranches. Bharti Airtel's net profit fell by 2.8% year-on-year to ₹830 crore in the third quarter.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Crypto industry seeks revision of 30% tax on crypto transactions
text: India's cryptocurrency industry seeks to appeal to the Centre to revise the 30% tax on crypto transactions announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. The proposal is being headed by the Blockchain and Crypto Assets Council. WazirX Founder Nischal Shetty also endorsed an online petition on the same lines started by crypto education portal Crypto India's Co-founder Aditya Singh.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Volvo Cars to invest $1.1 bn in Swedish plant to expand EVs production
text: In a move to expand production of fully electric cars, Volvo Cars will invest 10 billion crowns ($1.1 billion) in its Torslanda manufacturing plant in Sweden in the next few years, the company said on Tuesday. Last week, Volvo and battery maker Northvolt announced to build a joint battery plant in Gothenburg with an investment of 30 billion crowns.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Peloton shares jump after its CEO John Foley steps down
text: Shares of Peloton jumped more than 28% on Tuesday after the home fitness company said that its Co-founder John Foley will step down as CEO. Foley will be replaced by Barry McCarthy, the former Chief Financial Officer of Spotify and Netflix. The company also announced that it plans to cut 2,800 jobs which would affect 20% of its corporate workforce.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Fitness company Peloton offers 1-yr membership to fired employees
text: Home fitness company Peloton on Tuesday announced it is firing 2,800 employees and as part of the severance package, it will be offering a complimentary Peloton membership to impacted team members for the next year. Peloton will also offer a "meaningful cash severance" based on job level and tenure, extended healthcare coverage and equity vesting periods, alongside other benefits.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: German MNC Bosch to set up facility in Hyd & employ 3,000 people: KTR
text: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao has said that a German multinational company, Bosch, will set up a facility in Hyderabad. He said, "German MNC and...world leader in Mobility, Industrial Engineering and Home Appliances has chosen Hyderabad as a strategic location with its Bosch Global Software Technologies and R&D presence." The facility will provide employment to about 3,000 people, he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Reserve Bank of India may hike reverse repo rate to 3.55%: Poll
text: A Reuters poll of economists forecast suggests that the RBI will raise the reverse repo rate to 3.55% from 3.35%, narrowing the gap between the repo rate to 45 bps. As per the poll, the repo rate is expected to go up by 25 bps in April. Reverse repo rate is the rate at which central bank borrows from banks.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: IRCTC profit jumps 167% YoY to ₹209 crore in Q3
text: IRCTC on Tuesday reported a 167.41% year-on-year (YoY) rise in the October-December quarter with the net profit rising to ₹208.80 crore from ₹158.57 crore reported in September 2021 quarter. The revenue from operations jumped by 141% to ₹540.21 crore compared to ₹224.37 crore posted in the same period last fiscal. Internet ticketing segment contributed 58% to the revenue.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Over 71 lakh people enrolled under Atal Pension Yojana: Govt
text: The government-administered Atal Pension Yojana (APY) subscribers have reached over 71 lakh as of January 24, 2022, during 2021-22, MoS Finance Bhagwat Karad informed Parliament on Tuesday. The Atal Pension Yojana was launched in May 2015 with the objective of creating a universal social security system for all Indians. In FY20, there were over 68 lakh APY subscribers.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RBI begins 3 day monetary policy meet to decide on key rates
text: Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) began its three-day deliberations on Tuesday to decide the country's monetary policy in the backdrop of Budget 2022-23. The six-member committee headed by RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das is scheduled to announce the policy decision on Thursday. Experts opine that the MPC may change its policy stance from 'accommodative' to 'neutral'.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bank fraud complaints rose to 1.45 lakh in FY21, 7.28% YoY increase
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday that bank fraud complaints registered by the RBI under various Ombudsman schemes rose to 1,45,309 in FY21, a 7.28% YoY increase. RBI registered 1,35,448 complaints under various categories in FY20. Mobile/Electronic Banking complaints rose 12.01% and Credit Card complaints rose 52.99% between FY20 and FY21.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IPO-bound LIC may give 5% discount to policyholders: Reports
text: IPO-bound Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) might give a 5% discount on the IPO's price band to its policyholders, ET Now reported. It added that retail bidders and employees are also likely to be given a concession and that LIC may file its IPO prospectus on February 10. The government is likely to sell a 5-7% stake in LIC.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bharti Airtel's profit after tax falls 27% QoQ to ₹829.6 cr in Q3
text: Bharti Airtel reported a 27% QoQ fall in its profit after tax to ₹829.6 crore and a 5.4% QoQ rise in consolidated revenues at ₹29,866 crore in Q3. The company's consolidated operating profit also rose 6.3% QoQ to ₹14,905 crore while its average revenue per user jumped 6.5% QoQ to ₹163/user/month. Its consolidated operating margin also rose to 49.9%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Start demolition of Supertech's 40-storey twin tower in Noida within 2 weeks: SC
text: The Supreme Court on Monday ordered that the demolition works of Supertech’s 40-storied twin towers in Noida will start within two weeks. The court also directed NOIDA CEO to convene a meeting within 72 hours to finalise the schedule for demolition. It had also asked Supertech to refund the money with interest to all home-buyers by February 28.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: mCaffeine reveals its Valentine’s campaign with premium coffee gift sets
text: Caffeinated personal care brand mCaffeine unveiled its range of gift kits and urged its users to celebrate Valentine's with a fresh spin. These kits are gender-neutral with a blend of 100% natural and vegan ingredients, mCaffeine said, adding that customers can get these at flat 20% off for limited time. Users can head to the website to avail this offer.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Comfortable but damaging in long run: CRED Founder Kunal Shah on work from home
text: CRED Founder Kunal Shah has said that work from home is comfortable but damaging in the long run. Shah tweeted, "Impact of WFH on youth is the same as impact of children who study at home." He added, "No real bonds. No real social or network skills. Illusion of understanding and learning. No osmosis."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Meta says data regulations may cause Facebook, Instagram shutdown in Europe
text: Meta in its annual report to the US SEC said it might have to stop operating Instagram and Facebook in Europe due to data regulations. Meta said the regulations could adversely affect its ability to target ads, thus impacting its financial results. Meta said the services couldn't be offered in Europe if a new transatlantic data transfer framework isn't adopted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Peloton's CEO John Foley to step down, company to cut 2,800 jobs
text: Peloton's Co-founder John Foley is stepping down as CEO after leading the company since its inception, the US-based home fitness company told The Wall Street Journal. Barry McCarthy, former Chief Financial Officer of Spotify and Netflix, will become CEO as Foley will transition to Executive Chair. Peloton said it will cut roughly 2,800 jobs, affecting 20% of its corporate positions.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Wishy-washy words not needed, say sorry: Shiv Sena MP to Hyundai India
text: Shiv Sena's MP Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted to Hyundai India, "Wishy-washy words not needed...All you need to say is - we're unequivocally sorry." Hyundai India had issued a statement after Hyundai Pakistan's social media posts supported separatists in Kashmir. Hyundai India said, "The unsolicited post linking Hyundai Motor India is offending our unparalleled service to this great country."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: S Korean Minister calls Jaishankar over Pak Hyundai tweet, says 'We regret the offence'
text: After controversy over Hyundai Pakistan's social media posts on Kashmir, South Korean Foreign Minister Chung Eui-yong called up External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and said the country regretted the offence caused to the people and Government of India. MEA said, "It's...expected that such companies or their affiliates will refrain from false and misleading comments on...territorial integrity.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Be more forceful in your apology: Govt to Hyundai after Pak distributor's Kashmir tweet
text: Amid controversy over a tweet by Hyundai's Pakistani partner on Kashmir, Union Minister Piyush Goyal informed the Parliament that government has asked the company to be "more forceful in their unequivocal apology" on this issue. "This issue has been taken up both with the government there and the company concerned," he added. Several Indian Twitter users called for Hyundai's boycott.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: We deeply apologise: KFC India after brand's Pak account shares post on Kashmir
text: KFC India on Monday issued an apology after its Pakistan arm shared a social media post supporting 'Kashmir Day' on February 5, which led to a controversy. Taking to Twitter, KFC wrote, "We deeply apologise for a post that was published on some KFC social media channels outside the country. We...respect India, and remain steadfast in...serving... Indians with pride."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani gets richer than Ambani?
text: Elon Musk is the world's richest person with $235 billion wealth according to Bloomberg, followed by Jeff Bezos, Bernard Arnault, Bill Gates and Google Co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin. Warren Buffett is the world's 7th richest person, followed by Steve Ballmer and Larry Ellison. Gautam Adani, with $88.5 billion wealth, surpassed Mukesh Ambani as the world's 10th richest person.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex falls over 1,100 points, Nifty trades below 17,200-mark
text: The Sensex fell over 1,100 points during intra-day trade on Monday to trade at 57,423 while the Nifty slumped over 300 points to trade below the 17,200-mark. Both the indices had opened over 0.25% lower earlier in the day and slipped further. Except oil & gas, PSU bank, metal and power all other sectoral indices were trading in the red.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Gautam Adani overtakes Mukesh Ambani as Asia's richest person
text: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani surpassed Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani to become Asia's richest person after his net worth reached $88.5 billion on Monday, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Mukesh Ambani's net worth stands at $87.9 billion, as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Adani is the world's biggest wealth-gainer of 2022 so far.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: UK company spends ₹1 cr to take all employees on holiday for working in pandemic
text: UK-based Yolk Recruitment is spending over £100,000 (over ₹1 crore) to take all of its 55 employees on a holiday to thank them for working through the COVID-19 pandemic. It's taking them on an all-expense-paid trip to Tenerife, the largest of Spain's Canary Islands. Chief Commercial officer Pavan Arora said, "We want to thank employees for the last two years."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adani Wilmar shares to debut on BSE, NSE on February 8
text: The shares of one of India's largest FMCG companies, Adani Wilmar, will debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Tuesday. Adani Wilmar's IPO was subscribed 17.37 times during January 27-31, with support from all kinds of investors. The listing price could be around ₹265/share against the issue price of ₹230/share, according to experts.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to end at 57,621 dragged by financial, FMCG stocks
text: The Sensex on Monday slumped 1,023 points to settle at 57,621, dragged by financial, auto, IT and FMCG stocks. The Nifty 50 index fell 302 points to close at 17,213 points. A sharp cut in Monday's trading session comes amid heavy selling by FIIs amid rising US bond yields and crude oil prices.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla's bitcoin holding worth nearly $2 billion as of Dec 31
text: Tesla on Monday said in its annual filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission that its bitcoin holdings' fair market value as of December 31, 2021 was $1.99 billion. The company added that it registered about $101 million in impairment losses last year due to bitcoin's value. Tesla also briefly accepted crypto as payment for sales of certain products.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Toshiba to split into 2 companies instead of 3, spin off devices unit
text: Toshiba has announced that it will now split into two companies instead of three after facing fierce criticism from activist shareholders. The Japanese conglomerate will now spin off its devices business. It will use 300 billion yen ($2.6 billion) of excess capital for shareholder returns over two years. Toshiba said that the new plan is simpler and would save costs.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tourism body calls for commercial flight operations in full strength
text: The Federation of Associations in Indian Tourism and Hospitality (FAITH) asked the government to resume commercial flight operations in India in full strength. The country's inbound and outbound travel industry has been shut for the past 23 months, FAITH said in a statement. The body urged the Tourism Ministry to resume commercial flights "with zero quarantine to fully vaccinated travellers".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Macquarie cuts Paytm's target price, Goldman Sachs upgrades stock to 'buy'
text: Brokerage firm Macquarie on Monday retained its "underperform" rating on Paytm's stock and cut its target price to ₹700. Meanwhile, Goldman Sachs upgraded Paytm's stock to "buy" from "neutral" with a target price of ₹1,460, revised from ₹1,600 earlier. The development comes after Paytm parent, One97 Communications, reported a net loss of ₹778.4 crore in the quarter ended December.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt cancels ₹24,000 cr bond auction citing cash position
text: The government said that auction of all securities scheduled for February 11 has been cancelled, following review of its cash position. According to RBI's schedule, the government had planned to raise ₹24,000 crore in the auction. The decision comes after the benchmark 10-year bond yields surged to 6.87% on Friday, before rising to as high as 6.95% in the session.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India tops fintech investments in Asia-Pacific region with $5.94 bn in 2021
text: India continued to lead fintech investments in the Asia-Pacific region with $5.94 billion raised across 236 deals in 2021, according to S&P Global Market Intelligence report. India also topped the list in 2020, with $1.50 billion raised across 118 deals. Venture capital investments in Asian fintech companies surged to a record high of $15.69 billion in 2021, the report added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's GDP projected to be at ₹147.5 lakh cr in FY22: MoS Finance
text: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said on Monday that India's GDP in FY22 is estimated to grow at 9.2% to ₹147.5 lakh crore. He added that as per National Statistical Office's advance and revised estimates, India's real GDP increased from ₹105.3 lakh crore in 2014-15 to ₹135.6 lakh crore in 2020-21.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani Wilmar's shares surge after listing at 4% discount on debut
text: Shares of Adani Wilmar made a subdued debut on Tuesday as they listed at a discount of 4% on the issue price of ₹230 apiece. The company's shares later surged more than 17% to hit an intraday high of ₹270.40 on the NSE. The market capitalisation of Adani Wilmar, which raised ₹3,600 crore through IPO, now stands at ₹34,948 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Around 6.17 cr I-T returns, 19 lakh audit reports filed on new portal: CBDT
text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes said that around 6.17 crore income tax returns and about 19 lakh tax audit reports have been filed on the new income tax e-filing portal. Of the 6.17 crore returns filed till February 6, 48%, or 2.97 crore, are ITR-1, while 27%, or 1.65 crore, are ITR-4 and 13%, or 81.6 lakh, are ITR-3.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Spotify to invest $100 mn in content from underrepresented creators: CEO
text: Spotify CEO Daniel Ek said that the company will invest $100 million in the licensing, development and marketing of music and audio content from historically underrepresented creators. This is reportedly the same amount of money that Spotify paid to US podcaster Joe Rogan for his exclusive content deal. Rogan was criticised for use of racist language in his Spotify show.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt yet to decide on banks that are to be privatised: MoS Finance
text: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad told the Lok Sabha on Monday that the government is yet to decide on public sector banks (PSBs) that are to be privatised. The government had announced in Budget 2021 that it intended to privatise two PSBs during the year. He added that relevant Acts need to be amended for initiating privatisation process.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: MSMEs get extension till March 31 for registering on Udyam
text: MSMEs have been granted extension by the MSME Ministry for migrating to the Udyam registration portal that was launched on July 1, 2020. The deadline has been moved from December 31, 2021 to March 31, 2022. MSMEs not registered on Udyam can continue to avail benefits of provisions under various existing schemes and incentives, including priority sector lending till March-end.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: The focus is on growth and adoption for Digital India: Windmill Capital
text: Union Budget 2022 is focused on promoting digital economy, fintech and technology-enabled development, said Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd, a SEBI-registered research analyst- INH200007645. They added that unchanged financial support from government for this ecosystem will encourage further adoption of digital payments. WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases on themes like digital inclusion.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: What can you say when you no longer have your voice: Mahindra on Lata Mangeshkar
text: After Lata Mangeshkar passed away at 92 on Sunday, businessman Anand Mahindra wrote on Twitter, "What can you say when you no longer have your voice? Om Shanti." He also shared a black and white picture of her. Several leaders paid a tribute, including PM Narendra Modi, who wrote, "She leaves a void in our nation that cannot be filled."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Lata Mangeshkar will eternally cast her shadow over us: Shaw on 'Tu Jahan Jahan Chalega'
text: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw shared Lata Mangeshkar's song from 'Mera Saaya' (1996), 'Tu Jahan Jahan Chalega', on Twitter to mourn the veteran singer's demise. She'll "eternally cast her large shadow over us and remind us of her eternal legend. Om Shanthi", she wrote. The song's first line translates to "Wherever you go, remember my shadow will be with you".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: There's no greater tribute to our unity than Lata Didi: Gautam Adani
text: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani took to Twitter to condole the demise of veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar and wrote, "There can be no greater tribute to our unity than Lata Didi." He added, "If anyone represented all of India, it was Lata Didi lending her incomparable voice to songs in 36 languages." Lata Mangeshkar passed away aged 92 on Sunday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Nostalgia with moist eyes & lump in throat: Kotak on Lata Mangeshkar's demise
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank MD Uday Kotak took to Twitter to condole the demise of India's veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar. "India's favourite voice. Nostalgia with moist eyes and lump in the throat," he wrote, sharing a black-and-white picture of the late singer. Earlier, businessman Anand Mahindra and several celebrities including Priyanka Chopra paid a tribute to her on social media.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: COVID, you did your worst & stole our voice: Mahindra as Mangeshkar is cremated
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Sunday shared a picture from veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar's funeral and said, "COVID-19, you did your worst while leaving. (You) stole our voice. I hate you." The 92-year-old Bharat Ratna awardee was laid to rest with full state honours in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Mumbai on Sunday evening.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I used to catch Patna-Banaras train to listen to Lata ji's songs in theatre: Anil Agarwal
text: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal in a tweet said he remembers how he used to catch the Patna to Banaras train to watch the first day-last show of movies. "Such was the desperation to listen to Lata ji's songs in the theatre," he tweeted. "She'll always remain immortal in hearts, inspiring generations to come," Agarwal said, mourning Lata Mangeshkar's demise.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mahindra tweets video of kids running Punjab eatery, says 'going to binge here'
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Saturday shared a video of two brothers aged 17 and 11 years who've been running a restaurant in Punjab's Amritsar, after their father's death in December 2021. "These kids are amongst the pluckiest I've seen anywhere...I love Amritsar...I'm going to add this place to my food binge when I'm next in town," said Mahindra.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bezos gets richer by $19 bn in a day as Amazon adds record $191 bn in value
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' net worth climbed by $18.8 billion on Friday after the e-commerce giant's shares soared nearly 14%. Bezos, the world's third-richest person, is now worth $183.5 billion, according to Forbes. Amazon added $191 billion to its market value in the biggest single-day gain in US market history after beating profit expectations for the fourth quarter.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 19-yr-old tracking Elon Musk's jet refuses Tesla subscription offer to delete bot
text: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old college student who runs a Twitter account to track world's richest person Elon Musk's private jet, refused to accept a Tesla to delete the bot. Car-hire company Autonomy's CEO Scott Painter offered Sweeney a three-year subscription to a Tesla Model 3. "If I got an actual Tesla, then I would take it down," Sweeney said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI's digital rupee blockchain would be able to trace all transactions: Report
text: The digital rupee blockchain being developed by the RBI would be able to trace all transactions, unlike the current system of mobile wallets offered by private companies, PTI reported. The units issued in the digital rupee would be included in the currency in circulation, it added. The RBI's digital currency is likely to debut by early 2023.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Egyptian media tycoon charged with sexual assault of 7 orphan girls
text: Egyptian businessman Mohamed el-Amin has been charged with "human trafficking" and "sexual assault" and will be undergoing trial. The tycoon, who founded several Egyptian media outlets, was arrested on January 8 over accusations that he abused seven girls in an orphanage he founded and is currently in custody. The orphanage was shut last year after the allegations came to light.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tata Group shares how Air India was named 75 years ago via employees' votes
text: Tata Group tweeted the story behind how 'Air India' got its name 75 years ago when Tata Air Lines expanded from a division of Tata Sons into a company in 1946. The choices were Indian Airlines, Pan-Indian Airlines, Trans-Indian Airlines and Air-India. Tata employees voted and the final count showed 72 votes for Air-India and 58 for Indian Air Lines.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Hyundai India issues statement after Hyundai Pak's social media posts on Kashmir
text: Hyundai India issued a statement on Sunday after Hyundai Pakistan's social media posts supported "Kashmiri brothers" in their "struggle for freedom", which were later deleted. As Indian users called for the Hyundai brand's boycott, Hyundai India said, "The unsolicited social media post linking Hyundai Motor India is offending our unparalleled commitment and service to this great country."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Peloton stock jumps on reports of Amazon, Nike exploring bids to buy it
text: Shares of home fitness startup Peloton surged 26% in extended trading on Friday after media reports claimed Peloton has drawn interest from potential buyers including Amazon and Nike. Amazon and Nike are evaluating separate bids for Peloton and have not held direct talks with Peloton, the reports said. Last month, investor Blackwells Capital urged Peloton's board to pursue a sale.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ford to suspend or cut output at 8 factories due to chip shortage
text: Ford Motor plans to suspend or cut production at eight of its factories in the United States, Mexico and Canada throughout next week due to chip shortage in the factories, a spokesperson told Reuters. Ford will also reduce shifts at its factories in Dearborn, Kentucky and Louisville and remove overtime at its Oakville factory in Canada, from February 7.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Billionaire Bloomberg's housekeeper abducted at gunpoint, later rescued
text: A housekeeper at Colorado ranch of billionaire Michael Bloomberg was abducted by a man at gunpoint this week and has been freed unharmed. Joseph Beecher, who forced the housekeeper to drive them to Wyoming, has been taken into custody and jailed without bond. Michael Bloomberg said he was "deeply grateful" to law enforcement for "ensuring that no lives were lost".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: LIC ropes in 6 independent directors to meet corporate governance norms
text: IPO-bound Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) last month appointed six independent directors on its board to meet regulatory norms of corporate governance. LIC reportedly appointed ex-Financial Services Secretary Anjuly Chib Duggal, ex-SEBI member G Mahalingam, ex-SBI Life Managing Director Sanjeev Nautiyal, and Chartered Accountants MP Vijay Kumar, Raj Kamal, and V S Parthasarathy.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI's Monetary Policy Committee meeting rescheduled to February 8-10
text: The meeting of the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has been rescheduled to February 8-10, 2022 after Maharashtra government declared February 7 as a public holiday as a mark of respect to late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar. The meeting was earlier scheduled for February 7-9, 2022. It will be the MPC's last meeting during the financial year 2021-22.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Name auditorium after Toni Morrison, not me: Bezos to MLK Library
text: Billionaire Jeff Bezos has requested that the auditorium at the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Library be named after late Nobel Prize laureate Toni Morrison instead of himself. The development comes after thousands criticised the decision to name the auditorium "The Bezos Auditorium". Bezos said he was "honoured and grateful" when the foundation offered to name the auditorium after him.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹50,000 cr Self Reliant India fund likely to benefit 5,000 MSMEs: Rane
text: MSME Minister Narayan Rane said the ₹50,000 crore Self Reliant India fund, announced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in May 2020, is likely to benefit around 5,000 MSME units. The fund will make equity investments in MSMEs for their growth, listing on stock markets, and global expansion. The government is its sole anchor investor with initial support of ₹10,000 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We're keeping watch on global inflationary pressures: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "We're fairly watchful of what's happening as regards global developments...US Fed's decisions, as also regards global inflationary pressures." Speaking at a post-budget interaction, she added that the government will not allow the economy to suffer for lack of preparation. She said an opportunity was missed after the global financial crisis of 2008-09.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Makes no sense for staff to trek to office to be on Zoom: AmEx CEO
text: Speaking about hybrid model of working, American Express CEO Steve Squeri told Bloomberg, "It makes no sense to trek all the way in (to the office)...to sit on...Zoom or be on a phone." He said employees should "come in with purpose". American Express has asked New York-based staff to return to office at least one day a week from March.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Job creation is govt's priority and we are doing it: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while addressing the National Council of Confederation of Indian Industry at a post-budget interaction, said the government's priority is job creation and "we are doing it". She added that this year's Budget has again focused on demand-driven schemes. She further called on the Indian industry to invest in sunrise and new-age sectors.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SEBI should hear views of companies on Chairperson, MD posts separation: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said if companies have a view on the decision to separate posts of Chairperson and MD in listed companies, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) should hear them. "I am not giving them diktat," Sitharaman said. Listed entities are required to comply with the norms before the April 2022 deadline.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt prepared to deal with any global development: Nirmala Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday said India is ready to deal with any situation arising out of global developments. She urged corporates to take advantage of India's economic recovery and step up investment. "It's time now for us as Team India to rise. We are at such a juncture where revival of the economy is very clear," Sitharaman said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 67% MSMEs temporarily shut, profits dipped for 66% in FY21: SIDBI survey
text: A SIDBI survey showed that 67% MSMEs were temporarily shut for up to a three-month period in FY21 due to COVID-19. The survey, with a sample size of 1,029 MSMEs across 20 states and two UTs, also found that 66% MSMEs reported decline in profitability. The results were shared by MSME Minister Narayan Rane in the Lok Sabha on Thursday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: It's not my money: Musk as GoFundMe blocks C$10 mn raised for Canadian truckers
text: After GoFundMe blocked C$10 million (over ₹58 crore) raised for Canadian truckers protesting against COVID-19 vaccines, world's richest person Elon Musk referred to them as 'professional thieves' on Twitter. Responding to a Twitter user, Musk added, "It's not my money." The meme, shared by him, also referred to thieves raiding train cargo in the US as 'amateur thieves'.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Dutch locals to throw eggs at Bezos' superyacht if 1927 bridge is dismantled for it
text: After reports said the 1927 'De Hef' bridge in the Netherlands' Rotterdam will be dismantled to allow passage for Jeff Bezos' $500-million superyacht, residents have planned to throw "rotten eggs" at it. Locals created an event on Facebook for the same and over 1,000 people have signed up for it so far. The event description called Bezos a "megalomaniac billionaire".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon adds $191 billion in value in biggest 1-day gain in US market history
text: Amazon shares jumped nearly 14% on Friday to add $191 billion to its market value after it beat profit expectations for the fourth quarter. The advance is the biggest single-day gain in US market history, Bloomberg reported. It came a day after Facebook's parent company Meta lost $251 billion in market capitalisation in the biggest wipeout in US market history.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon adds $135 bn in one of the biggest 1-day gains in US market
text: Amazon added more than $135 billion in market value in one of the biggest single-day gains in US stock market history after its shares surged as much as 12% on Friday. The company's stock surged after it beat profit expectations for the fourth quarter. On Thursday, Amazon stock declined 7.8%, wiping out more than $110 billion from its market value.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: More top executives resign after Better.com CEO who laid off 900 staff returns
text: Two more top executives of US-based online mortgage lender Better.com have resigned, days after Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, returned as CEO after a break from full-time duties. One of the executives, Sarah Pierce, was upset with the way Garg publicly disparaged the employees, majority of whom had reported to her, TechCrunch reported citing sources.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Musk's Neuralink may have misled US regulators about his role: Report
text: Billionaire Elon Musk's brain-chip startup Neuralink may have misled US regulators about Musk's role at the company, Fortune reported. In a 2018 letter to the US SEC, an attorney representing Neuralink wrote "Musk has no executive or management role at Neuralink". In 2018, Musk held a decision-making role at Neuralink and referred to himself as CEO, former employees told Fortune.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Mukesh Ambani buys ₹13cr Rolls-Royce SUV, one of India's most expensive cars: Report
text: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani has bought Rolls-Royce Cullinan costing ₹13.14 crore, one of India's most expensive cars, PTI reported quoting RTO officials. While base price of the car is said to be ₹6.95 crore, reports claimed that customised modifications substantially raised the SUV's price. A one-time tax of ₹20 lakh has reportedly been paid by RIL for the car.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: JD.com's billionaire CEO to donate shares worth $2.3 billion to charity
text: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's Founder and CEO Richard Liu will donate company shares worth about $2.3 billion to charity, JD.com has announced. The move comes amid Chinese President Xi Jinping's call to achieve "common prosperity", which seeks to narrow wealth inequality. According to Bloomberg Billionaires Index, 49-year-old Liu has a net worth of $16.3 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Jio invests $15 million in US-based startup Two Platforms for 25% stake
text: Jio has announced that it has invested $15 million in Silicon Valley-based startup Two Platforms for a 25% equity stake on a fully diluted basis. "TWO is an Artificial Reality company with focus on building interactive and immersional AI experiences," Jio said. "Jio is foundational to India's digital transformation. We...are excited to partner with Jio," TWO CEO Pranav Mistry said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: There will be corrective action based on audit report: BharatPe board Chairman
text: BharatPe board Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said that the board will launch "corrective action" depending on the audit report by Alvarez and Marsal, that is examining corporate governance issues. The board is yet to receive the report, he added. Earlier, reports claimed that a preliminary probe by the risk advisory firm found fraudulent transactions including payments to non-existent vendors.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Couple arrested for evading GST of ₹12 crore in Thane
text: Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) authorities in Thane have arrested a couple, a 50-year-old man and his 48-year-old wife, for allegedly evading GST of ₹12.23 crore. The couple were partners in a city-based firm, Datalink Consultancy. They charged GST from high-profile companies for providing manpower but didn't deposit it to government exchequer for over a year, an official said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Got no request to dismantle bridge for Bezos' superyacht: Dutch Mayor
text: The Mayor of Rotterdam in the Netherlands has said that he hasn't received any application for a permit to temporarily dismantle a historic bridge to allow billionaire Jeff Bezos' superyacht to pass. "No decision has yet been taken," said Ahmed Aboutaleb. He added the Amazon Founder or his shipbuilder Oceanco may have to foot the bill if it happens.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: IndiGo appoints Co-founder Rahul Bhatia as Managing Director
text: Budget carrier IndiGo's parent company InterGlobe Aviation announced on Friday that it has appointed its Co-founder Rahul Bhatia as Managing Director with immediate effect. Bhatia has been appointed for a period of five years and will not draw any remuneration during his tenure, the company said. Bhatia and Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal together own a 74.44% stake in the company.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance Jio network down in Mumbai, users share memes on Twitter
text: Several Reliance Jio users complained on Twitter that they had no network on their phones on Saturday afternoon, most of which were from Mumbai and nearby areas. Filmmaker Ashoke Pandit also complained he wasn't able to make calls. "I was freaking out about my Jio sim not working but...it's not just me," a Twitter user wrote. Users also shared memes.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Budget 2022 focused on capex, boosting infra: Hiranandani Group MD
text: Budget 2022 focused on capital expenditure, manufacturing and 'atmanirbharta' in defence and also push on infrastructure, Hiranandani Group MD Niranjan Hiranandani said. The Budget grants infrastructure status to data centres which will "enable India to become a global data centre hub", he added. It also strikes "a balance between macro-growth with micro-all-inclusive welfare", he said further.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Markets shouldn't worry about high borrowing number in Budget: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the markets "should not get flustered" about the government's borrowing numbers. During the Union Budget, the government pegged the gross market borrowing number at ₹14.95 lakh crore for 2022-23. Following the news, bond yields rose to their highest level in nearly two years. Sitharaman said it may be due to global changes as well.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt hasn't acknowledged reality of jobs crisis: CMIE CEO on Budget
text: Reacting to the Budget 2022-23, CEO of Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) Mahesh Vyas said that the budget overlooked the factors that are influencing the decline in the employment rate. "The government has not even acknowledged the reality of the jobs crisis," he added. "There is an absence of a microeconomic view and a macroeconomic solution," he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates $133 mn to education non-profit
text: Amazon's billionaire Founder Jeff Bezos' ex-wife and philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated $133.5 million to Communities in Schools (CIS). "The unprecedented gift is the largest unrestricted donation in CIS' history," the US-based education nonprofit said. MacKenzie Scott has a net worth of $46.6 billion, as per Bloomberg. She has donated more than $8.6 billion to over 780 organisations.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Paytm net loss widens to ₹778.5 crore in Q3, revenue surges 89%
text: Paytm parent One 97 Communications' consolidated net loss widened to ₹778.5 crore in October-December quarter as against ₹535.5 crore loss posted in the year-ago period. The company reported net loss of ₹473.5 crore in the September quarter. The revenue from operations jumped by 89% to ₹1,456.1 crore in Q3 compared to ₹772 crore recorded in the corresponding period of 2020.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Clear loans of homebuyers of twin tower project by Mar 31: SC to Supertech
text: Supreme Court has directed Supertech to clear all outstanding bank loans of homebuyers, who'd invested in the twin towers at its Noida's Emerald Court project by March 31. This was in addition to an earlier order wherein Supertech was directed to refund the amounts paid by homebuyers by February 28. The twin towers were ordered to be demolished last year.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Wine sales may jump 25% as Maha allows sale in supermarkets: AIWPA
text: Days after Maharashtra government allowed the sale of wine in supermarkets and shelf-in shops, All India Wine Producers Association (AIWPA) said that wine sales in the state could rise 25-30%. Maharashtra accounts for 25-30% of the total wine sales in the country, which roughly translates to around 75-90 lakh litres, AIWPA President Jagdish Holkar added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: IndiGo posts ₹130 cr profit in Q3 after reporting losses for 7 quarters
text: InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of India's biggest airline IndiGo, has reported a net profit of ₹129.79 crore for the third quarter ended December 2021, after posting losses for seven consecutive quarters. The company's revenue from operations rose 89.3% year-on-year to ₹9,294.8 crore during the period. Its passenger ticket revenues were up 98.4% and stood at ₹8,073.1 crore for the quarter.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IndusInd Bank files insolvency plea against Zee over ₹83 cr default
text: IndusInd Bank has moved the National Company Law Tribunal seeking to initiate corporate insolvency proceedings against Zee Entertainment claiming a default of ₹83 crore. Zee is a party to the Debt Service Reserve Account Guarantee Agreement with IndusInd Bank for a term loan facility advanced to Siti Networks. Earlier, Axis Bank had sent a legal notice to Zee's promoters.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: I spent a lot of time in writing my Budget 2022 speech: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told ET NOW that she herself wrote Budget 2022 speech which was her shortest Budget speech. "I've spent a lot of time in making sure that the words matter," she said. Income from virtual digital assets will be taxed at 30% and 'digital rupee' will be issued by RBI starting 2022-23, Sitharaman announced in her speech.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adani Wilmar fixes issue price at ₹230 apiece for ₹3,600 crore IPO
text: Adani Wilmar has finalised the issue price for its ₹3,600 crore IPO at the upper end of its price band at ₹230 per share. The company's shares are expected to list on the bourses on February 8. Its offer was subscribed 17.37 times between January 27 and January 31, with non-institutional investors bidding for 56.3 times the allotted quota.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SBI posts highest ever quarterly net profit of ₹8,432 crore in Q3
text: State Bank of India reported its highest ever net profit of ₹8,431.9 crore for the October-December quarter, a jump of 62% as compared to ₹5,196 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Interest earned for the quarter rose 4.41% YoY to ₹69,678 crore. SBI's net interest income (NII) rose 6.48% to ₹30,687 crore from ₹28,820 crore in Q3 of 2020.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's coffee exports rise by 28% in 2021, earn $950 million
text: Indian coffee exports rose 28% to around 3,95,700 tonnes and earned nearly $950 million in 2021, the highest figure achieved in last ten years, Coffee Board data showed. The surge in exports in the last few months was because of "pent-up demand", Coffee Exporters Association said. Coffee shipments shrank to 3,08,050 tonnes worth $714 million in 2020 due to COVID-19.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Self-taught beautician to micro-entrepreneur, meet Asha: Urban Company
text: The latest episode of Urban Company Impact interviews Asha Thakur, a small-town woman, who believes women should always fly high. She talks about how she struggled for 7 years, learning the trade all by herself and working with different parlours, until she finally joined Urban Company as an independent salon professional and found the growth she was looking for.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: This is an infrastructure and growth-focused Budget: Windmill Capital
text: Capex outlay has been increased and private capital will be required to finance infrastructure projects, said Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd, a SEBI-registered research analyst - INH200007645 about Budget 2022. Enhancing viability with best practices, innovative financing, and balanced risk allocation will be facilitated to focus on growth, it added. WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Facebook parent Meta's $230-billion wipeout biggest in US market history
text: Facebook's parent Meta's shares plunged 27% and Thursday's collapse wiped out $230 billion of the company's market value. It's the biggest collapse in market value for any US company but there's no certainty that the losses will hold, given the volatility, Bloomberg said. This comes after Facebook's daily active users fell for the first time in its 18-year history.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Meta drops below Berkshire Hathaway in market value for 1st time in 2 yrs
text: Meta Platforms is now worth about $50 billion less than Berkshire Hathaway after the social media giant's stock plunged 27% on Thursday, wiping out over $250 billion from its market capitalisation. Meta overtook billionaire investor Warren Buffett-led Berkshire in market value nearly two years ago. Buffett is now richer than Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who lost $31 billion on Thursday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Mark Zuckerberg loses $31 bn in one of the biggest one-day drops in wealth ever
text: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's wealth dropped by $31 billion in one of the biggest one-day drops in wealth ever, Bloomberg reported on Thursday. Zuckerberg's net worth is now estimated at $92 billion, down from $120.6 billion as of market close on Wednesday. This comes after Meta's fourth-quarter results fell short of analysts' expectations and the company's shares fell around 25%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ambani, Adani become richer than Zuckerberg after he loses $29 billion: Forbes
text: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani are now richer than Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg, as per Forbes' real-time billionaires list. Zuckerberg's wealth fell by $29.7 billion to $84.8 billion as Facebook's parent company Meta's shares crashed 26% after a weak revenue forecast. Adani's fortune stood at $90.1 billion, while Ambani's fortune is $90 billion.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Facebook's user growth in India slowed due to data price rise: Meta CFO
text: Facebook's user growth in India was hit due to a hike in prepaid data prices in the fourth quarter of 2021, Meta CFO David Wehner has said. This came after the social media giant recorded a drop in its Daily Active Users (DAUs) for the first time in its 18-year history. Wehner also blamed "competitive services" for the DAU drop.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Facebook facing unprecedented level of competition: CEO after Meta's $251 bn wipeout
text: At a virtual meeting, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg explained that the stock crashed due to weak revenue forecast in the current quarter and asked employees to focus on Facebook's short-video product. Zuckerberg reportedly said Facebook is facing an "unprecedented level of competition" due to video platforms like TikTok. Meta's stock collapse wiped out $251 billion in market value on Thursday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Drop in Meta's market value more than the total value of India's largest firm: Kotak
text: After Facebook parent Meta lost $251 billion in market value, suffering the biggest wipeout in US market's history, Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO Uday Kotak said, "That is more than the total value of India's largest company." "It highlights the fragility and fickleness of our times. Welcome to the never normal world," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Why did Facebook's parent company Meta lose $200 billion in one day?
text: Facebook parent Meta's shares fell over 20% early Thursday causing a $200-billion wipeout after Facebook reported a fall in daily active users for the first time in 18-year history. Facebook said it faces increased competition for users' time and shift of engagement from core News Feed to Reels. Facebook's Reality Labs, that's building 'metaverse', lost over $10 billion in 2021.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Facebook parent Meta's rating cut by JPMorgan for 1st time since its IPO
text: JPMorgan Chase analyst Doug Anmuth has downgraded his rating on Facebook parent Meta to "neutral" from "overweight" and lowered the share price target after the company's earnings report. The cut took place for the first time since the company went public in 2012, Bloomberg reported. On Thursday, Meta's shares tanked over 26%, erasing more than $251 billion in market value.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I am sorry for nothing: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover to employees
text: When asked if he'd want to say something to his employees who feel "mistreated", BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover told Moneycontrol, "I'm sorry for nothing." "I'm absolutely unapologetic...I have the best of intentions," he said. One can't expect someone to "create a $6 billion dollar business in less than four years" and "want everything to be perfect, including culture", Grover added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ashneer Grover seeks removal of CEO Suhail Sameer from BharatPe's board: Reports
text: BharatPe Co-founder and MD Ashneer Grover, who's currently on leave, has reportedly sought to remove CEO Suhail Sameer as a director on the company's board. In a letter dated February 2, Grover stated that he's withdrawing his nomination for Sameer's appointment on the board, reports said. In an interview to Moneycontrol, Grover referred to Sameer as "a puppet of investors".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shaadi.com's Anupam Mittal invested ₹5.4 crore in 24 businesses on Shark Tank India
text: Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal revealed on LinkedIn that he has committed ₹5.4 crore to 24 businesses on Shark Tank India, of which 50% are led by women entrepreneurs and 70% by youngsters. Out of a total of 198 pitches, 67 businesses received deals on the show, he wrote. Of them, 87% of the founders had no IIT/IIM degrees, Mittal added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: If board thinks I shouldn't be MD, they can give me ₹4,000 crore: BharatPe's Ashneer
text: When asked whether he considered resigning amid BharatPe's governance review, Ashneer Grover told Moneycontrol, "Why would I resign? I am the MD. I run the company." "If the board thinks I don't need to be the MD...Please put my ₹4,000 crore on the table and take the key from me," he added. Grover also accused the board of "arm-twisting" him.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: The idea was forced into my head by CEO Suhail: BharatPe's Ashneer on voluntary leave
text: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover told Moneycontrol it wasn't his idea to go on leave till March-end amid the Kotak controversy. "That idea was forced into my head basis misrepresentations from Suhail (CEO) and Sumeet (General Counsel)...in connivance with investors," he explained. "All of them sided with investors and said you should go," Grover said, calling Suhail a "puppet of investors".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: BharatPe board lawyered up to arm-twist me: Ashneer on governance review
text: After BharatPe's board hired two firms for a corporate governance review, Co-founder Ashneer Grover alleged that the board is "trying to lawyer up and arm-twist" him. "What is this sending on temporary leave of absence? It's not defined in my SHA (shareholder agreement)," he told Moneycontrol. Grover added that he hasn't been told what the audit is about.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI examining if BharatPe violated corporate governance rules: Report
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is examining if there were violations of corporate governance rules at BharatPe amid the recent controversy involving its Co-founder Ashneer Grover, reported Moneycontrol. BharatPe and Centrum Financial Services are joint venture partners of Unity Small Finance Bank. The fintech startup's board has hired two firms to conduct a corporate governance review.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹4,355-cr PMC Bank scam accused arrested in Bihar while trying to flee country
text: Daljit Singh Bal, who was a director of PMC Bank when the ₹4,355-crore scam was unearthed in Maharashtra, has been arrested near Bihar-Nepal border, immigration officials said. He was held along with his wife and son and "was planning to leave for Canada via Kathmandu", AK Pankaj, DSP (immigration), said. In 2019, Mumbai Police issued a lookout circular against him.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Emami Founders step down from executive roles to make way for next gen
text: Emami Founders RS Agarwal and RS Goenka have stepped down from their executive positions to transition the business to their next generation. The board appointed Goenka as Non-Executive Chairman while re-designating RS Agarwal as Chairman Emeritus. Agarwal's younger son Harsha V Agarwal and Goenka's eldest son Mohan Goenka have been in the FMCG business for over two decades.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air to offer stock options to attract staff
text: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air, which may start flying in late May, is planning to offer stock options to attract staff. The stock options will be "far greater than most airlines in India and hopefully reminiscent of maybe some...tech startups", CEO Vinay Dube said. However, stock options may not be given to air crew or regular pilots, BloombergQuint reported.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Budget 2022-23 thoughtful policy agenda for India: IMF MD
text: Reacting to India's Budget 2022-23, International Monetary Fund's MD Kristalina Georgieva said that it is a very ''thoughtful policy agenda''. ''We are very positive on the fact that India is thinking of addressing short-term issues, but also long-term structural transformation," she added. "There's a great deal of emphasis placed on innovation on research...and digitalisation,'' she said further.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Before Meta, which firms recorded biggest 1-day drops in US market history?
text: Facebook's parent Meta's shares lost over $251 billion in market value on Thursday in the biggest collapse for any US company. Before this, the record was held by Apple, which shed nearly $180 billion on September 3, 2020, as per Bloomberg. Microsoft had lost $178 billion on March 16, 2020 and Tesla lost $140 billion on November 9, 2021.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Duties not a hindrance: CBIC chief on Tesla's call for tax breaks
text: Speaking about Tesla's demand for import duty cuts on electric vehicles, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs' (CBIC) Chairman, Vivek Johri, said that duties are "not a hindrance". "We looked at whether the duties need to be re-jigged, but some domestic production is happening and some investments have come in with the current tariff structure," Johri told Bloomberg.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Nike sues StockX over sale of unauthorised NFTs of its sneakers
text: Nike sued online reseller StockX in the US for selling unauthorised NFTs of its sneakers. The complaint said StockX has sold over 500 Nike-branded NFTs. StockX allegedly told buyers they would be able to redeem the tokens for physical versions of the shoes in future. Nike has complained about the NFTs' "inflated prices and murky terms of purchase and ownership".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bosch India to invest over ₹1,000 cr in localisation of advanced auto tech
text: Auto components firm Bosch has said that it will invest over ₹1,000 crore in India for the localisation of advanced automotive technologies over the next five years and support the government's Atmanirbhar Bharat mission. Bosch, which completed its 100th year in the Indian market, also launched its mobility marketplace to provide its mobility-related assets under one platform.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Manyavar owner gets ₹945 crore from anchor investors ahead of IPO
text: Ethnic wear brand Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions mobilised ₹945 crore from 75 anchor investors ahead of its IPO, which opened for subscription on Friday. The company has allotted over one crore equity shares to anchor investors at its upper price band. Vedant Fashions has fixed the price band at ₹824-₹866 per share and is raising ₹3,150 crore through its IPO.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RBI cancels licence of Maha-based Independence Co-operative Bank
text: RBI has cancelled licence of Maharashtra-based Independence Co-operative Bank, citing inadequate capital. It will cease to carry on banking operations from the close of business on February 3. In the present situation, the bank won't be able to pay its depositors in full, RBI said. It added that the bank didn't comply with multiple sections of Banking Regulation Act, 1949.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Mumbai businessman Pravin Raut arrested in ₹1,034-crore chawl land scam case by ED
text: The ED has arrested Guruashish Construction's former Director Pravin Raut in the ₹1,034-crore Patra chawl land scam case. ED alleged that Raut and Housing Development Infrastructure's promoters, Rakesh and Sarang Wadhawan, "illegally sold FSI (floor space index)" to various builders. They siphoned off the money without any intent to complete the redevelopment project in Mumbai's Goregaon, ED said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Boost to EVs a big step: Windmill Capital
text: Increased use of EVs in public transport, special mobility zones with zero fossil-fuel policy are positive steps for the sector and companies will be encouraged to develop innovative business models for 'Energy as a Service', stated Windmill Capital Pvt Ltd, a SEBI-registered research analyst- INH200007645. WCPL creates baskets of stocks called smallcases on themes like EVs and Rural demand.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Mark Zuckerberg risks losing $24 billion wealth as Meta shares crash
text: Mark Zuckerberg risks losing $24 billion from his personal wealth as Meta's shares crashed over 20% in after-hours trading on Wednesday following its fourth-quarter earnings. If the move holds, his fortune will fall from $120.6 billion (at market close) to $97 billion, Bloomberg reported. This will take Zuckerberg off the world's 10 richest persons list for first time since 2015.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tesla co-worker used N-word, threw a hot tool at me: Black, gay ex-worker in lawsuit
text: A former Tesla worker has filed a lawsuit against the company for failing to address racial, homophobic behaviour directed towards her by a co-worker. The co-worker struck Kaylen Barker with a hot grinding tool while calling her the "N-word" and a "b***h", the suit alleged. Barker said she was "violated physically, mentally, and emotionally" because she's an "African-American lesbian".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bezos to dismantle 1927 Dutch bridge to let his $500-million superyacht pass: Report
text: The Netherlands' Rotterdam will reportedly dismantle its 'De Hef' bridge, built in 1927, to allow passage for a 127-metre-long superyacht that's being built in Alblasserdam for world's second richest person Jeff Bezos. The Amazon Founder and shipbuilder Oceanco will pay the costs incurred, local media said. The $500-million three-masted yacht will need to pass through Rotterdam to reach the ocean.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Facebook's daily active users fall for first time in 18-year history
text: Facebook has seen its daily active users (DAUs) fall for the first time in its 18-year history. Facebook's parent company Meta said DAUs fell to 1.929 billion in the three months to the end of December, compared to 1.930 billion in the previous quarter. Meta's shares fell over 20% in after-hours trading, wiping $200 billion off the company's market value.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Melinda not to give majority of wealth to Gates Foundation: WSJ
text: Melinda French Gates, Co-founder of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, will no longer be pledging the majority of her wealth to the philanthropic organisation, the Wall Street Journal reported. She will instead distribute much of her fortune across other philanthropies. Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates and Melinda had earlier pledged to give the bulk of their fortune to the foundation.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: List shows unemployment rate in Indian states; highest in Haryana, lowest in Telangana
text: Independent think-tank Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy has released a list showing unemployment rate in Indian states in January 2022. Haryana has the highest unemployment rate at 23.4%, followed by Rajasthan (18.9%) and  Tripura (17.1%). Telangana reported the lowest unemployment rate at 0.7% in January this year, followed by Gujarat (1.2%), Meghalaya (1.5%) and Odisha (1.8%).
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Crypto transactions done before April 2022 won't be tax-free: CBDT Chairman
text: CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra was quoted by ANI as saying, "Crypto investors should know that the transactions done before April 2022 will not be tax-free." He added, "The taxability of the crypto-currency is certain for this financial year too." Earlier, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said the income tax return forms will have a separate column for crypto from next year.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Unemployment rate falls to 6.57%, lowest since March 2021: CMIE
text: After hitting a four-month high in December, India's unemployment rate fell sharply to 6.57% in January, the lowest since March 2021, Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) data showed. Unemployment in urban India fell to 8.16%, while in rural areas it was 5.84%. Telangana reported the lowest unemployment rate at 0.7% in January, while Haryana had the highest at 23.4%.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Woman banker in UK wins ₹21 cr in case after male employee paid more for same role
text: A woman banker at BNP Paribas in London was awarded £2,081,449 (over ₹21 crore) by an employment judge after she complained of unequal pay. Stacey Macken, paid £120,000 annually, found out that a man hired with the same job title and responsibilities was being paid £160,000. She also said drunken male colleagues once left a witch's hat on her desk.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: CNN President Jeff Zucker quits over undisclosed relationship with senior executive
text: CNN's President Jeff Zucker resigned after failing to disclose his relationship with CNN's Executive VP and CMO Allison Gollust. Zucker said, "I acknowledged the relationship evolved in recent years...I was required to disclose it when it began but I didn't. I was wrong." Gollust, who's remaining at CNN, said, "I regret we didn't disclose our relation at the right time."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Budget aims at inclusive development, is forward-looking: ICSI & ICAI
text: The Institute of Company Secretaries of India called the Budget "progressive" as it aims at "inclusive development through incentivising MSME sector and startups". It focuses on strengthening the digital payment ecosystem, ICSI added. The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India said the Budget was "forward-looking" and the "proposal to tax virtual digital assets at 30% provides certainty".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Budget will sustain growth, has disappointed middle-class, startups: Pai
text: Former Infosys CFO TV Mohandas Pai said that the Union Budget 2022 carries forward the government's growth and development efforts but has been disappointing for startups and the middle-class. "India can expect to be on high growth path for the next two-three years," said Pai and added that the middle-class and startups have not been given any tax relief.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: TCS to expand operations in New Jersey, add 1,000 employees by 2023
text: Tata Consultancy Services will expand operations in New Jersey by hiring about 1,000 additional employees by 2023 to meet growing needs of customers to digitally transform their businesses, it said. It'll also grow the reach of its STEM and computer science education programs in New Jersey by 25%, the company added. Currently, TCS has over 3,700 employees in New Jersey.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cognizant reports highest-ever quarterly revenue at $4.8 billion
text: Cognizant's revenue for the December quarter rose by 14.2% year-on-year to $4.8 billion, its highest-ever quarterly revenue. For the full year 2021, Cognizant reported a 10% year-on-year growth in revenue to $18.5 billion. It expects its full-year 2022 revenue to grow 8.5-11.5% in constant currency to $20-20.5 billion, its highest-ever annual revenue outlook.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Musk protected by rights for his tweet on staff unionising: Lawyers
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyers have argued in the US that he is protected by constitutional right to free speech in case of his 2018 tweet on his staff unionising. Judges had questioned whether Musk had threatened workers with the loss of stock options if they formed a union. The US NLRB had ordered for Musk to remove the tweet.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: No property tax for flats with 500 sq ft carpet area in Mumbai: BMC
text: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Thursday announced that flats in Mumbai with 500 square feet of carpet area have been granted 100% relief from property tax. "About 16,14,000 citizens will get 100% property tax relief. The amount of exemption to citizens is to the tune of ₹462 crore per annum," BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal said in his budget speech.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tata Steel's Dutch arm faces criminal probe over 'intentional' pollution
text: Dutch public prosecutors have launched a criminal probe against the Dutch arm of Tata Steel for alleged "intentional and unlawful" pollution of surface water. The probe has also been launched against Harsco Metals Holland, which operates on Tata Steel's premises. The investigation follows a complaint filed by a lawyer representing 800 persons and organisations in May 2021 against the companies.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Reports on merger with parent firm 'speculative, misleading': Vedanta
text: Metals and mining major Vedanta Limited has denied media reports about its merger with parent company Vedanta Resources as "speculative and misleading" to investors. Reports said that billionaire Anil Agarwal held preliminary talks with advisers about combining the indebted holding company with its listed Indian unit Vedanta Limited. "No such proposal is under consideration," the firm clarified.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: LIC's embedded value could be set at over ₹5 trillion: Govt official
text: The embedded value of Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) could be more than ₹5 trillion, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey told Reuters. "I would say...the enterprise value will be multiples of [the embedded value]," Pandey said. He added that the government plans to issue a draft red herring prospectus to investors early next week.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CCI penalises MRF, Apollo Tyres & others for indulging in cartelisation
text: Competition Commission of India (CCI) has imposed a penalty of ₹1,788.06 crore on Apollo Tyres, MRF, CEAT, JK Tyre and Birla Tyres for "indulging in cartelisation". "The tyre manufacturers had exchanged price-sensitive data amongst them through the platform of Automotive Tyre Manufacturers Association (ATMA) and had taken a collective decision on the prices of tyres," CCI said in a statement.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: MRF to challenge CCI's ₹622 crore cartelisation charge
text: MRF Ltd said it will challenge Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order imposing a ₹622.09 crore penalty on the company for "indulging in cartelisation". MRF said that the order "is not based on a proper appreciation of facts and law". A ₹1,788.06 crore penalty was imposed on MRF, Apollo Tyres, CEAT, JK Tyre and Birla Tyres by CCI on Wednesday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Services sector activity slips to 6-month low of 51.5 in January
text: India's services sector activity hit six-month low in January as the IHS Markit India Services PMI dipped to 51.5 in January from 55.5 in December 2021. The composite PMI also fell from 56.4 in December to 53.0 in January, the data showed. The escalation of the pandemic and inflationary pressures led to the slow growth across services, IHS Markit said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Banks urge SC to allow Amazon, Reliance to bid for Future Retail
text: The 27 lenders to Future Group urged the Supreme Court to allow Amazon and Reliance to bid for Future Retail's assets to facilitate recovery of ₹17,000 crore. Senior Advocate Rakesh Dwivedi, the banks' representative, said banks have begun classifying Future Retail as a non-performing asset. He added that bidding is the only "sure shot" method of recovering the money.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Climb the leaderboard on final day of shopping fest to win rewards: CRED
text: CRED brings the leaderboard where its members can win various rewards during Republic of CRED shopping festival by redeeming CRED coins on in-app deals. The top 3 members can win a 24-inch iMac, the next 7 win iPhone 13 128 GB, and the following 40 win Apple Airpods, CRED announced. Today is the last day to avail these offers.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Every 15 seconds a millennial opens a savings account with us: Jupiter
text: Citing convenience and personalisation as top priorities, millennials now prefer a digital-only banking experience as they want to feel like they're in control and are being smarter with their spending, stated Jupiter, a digital-only banking app. Built for these evolving needs, combined with our customer experience innovations, we're seeing exponential growth in millennial users, added Jupiter.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Crypto investment doesn't have govt authorisation, govt not responsible for loss: Finance Secy
text: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan was quoted by ANI as saying, "People investing in private crypto should understand it doesn't have the authorisation of the government." He added, "There's no guarantee whether your investment will be successful or not, one may suffer losses and government is not responsible for this." He added, "Bitcoin, Ethereum or NFT will never become legal tender."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Crypto assets not illegal, to be taxed like gambling win: Finance Secretary
text: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan told Bloomberg TV, "Crypto assets are currently neither illegal nor are they encouraged. They are in a grey area." He added, "It's not illegal to buy and sell crypto assets in India...but we've now put in a taxation framework that treats crypto assets the same way that we treat winnings from horse races or from bets."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bitcoin, Ethereum or NFT will never become legal tender: Finance Secretary
text: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan was quoted by ANI as saying, "Bitcoin, Ethereum or NFT will never become legal tender." He added, "People investing in private crypto should understand it doesn't have government authorisation...one may suffer losses and government isn't responsible for this." He also said, "Some people declare their crypto assets, some don't. Now uniform rate will be 30% tax."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mahindra offers to fund IITians' 3D printing startup, asks 'Any room for me to join?'
text: Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to offer funds to Tvasta, a startup by three IIT Madras alumni that made India's first 3D printed house. Mahindra tweeted, "I know you raised some seed funding, but any room for me to join in?" India's first 3D printed house, printed and assembled in 21 days, was inaugurated at IIT Madras campus in 2021.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ratan Tata welcomes flyers onboard Air India flights, airline shares voice note
