They were given prison sentences from six months to one-and-a-half years, court documents showed. The officials interfered with monitoring devices to allow release of large quantities of pollutants in 2021.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Air India seeks to settle $1.2 billion lawsuit in US citing new owner: Reports
text: After Tata Group's takeover, Air India is reportedly seeking to end a case filed by Devas Multimedia in a US court, arguing that recent change in ownership prevents demands over recovery of arbitration awards. Devas demanded $1.2 billion from Indian government and sought to seize Air India's overseas assets by calling the carrier an alter ego of Indian government.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley CEOs become best-paid US banks' CEOs
text: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon will receive $35 million in compensation for 2021, up from $17.5 million a year ago. He was required to return a third of his pay last year as penalty for the bank's role in an international bribery scandal. Solomon is now tied with Morgan Stanley's James Gorman as the highest-paid CEOs at major US banks.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: HP wins fraud case against UK tech tycoon Lynch over Autonomy deal
text: Hewlett Packard has won most of its civil case against British tech tycoon Mike Lynch over its acquisition of Autonomy in 2011, a London judge ruled. HP had sued Lynch alleging he had fraudulently inflated the value of Autonomy before selling it to HP. The judge said HP will likely receive less than the $5 billion it demanded in damages.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tech tycoon Lynch's extradition to US to face criminal charges approved
text: The UK government has approved tech tycoon Mike Lynch's extradition to the US to face criminal fraud charges. Lynch can appeal the order and a separate court's decision allowing his extradition. Prior to the extradition ruling, a London judge ruled the tech tycoon was dishonest in the $11 billion sale of his company to Hewlett Packard in 2011.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie sold Amazon stock worth $8.5 bn last year
text: World's fifth-richest woman MacKenzie Scott cut her stake in Amazon by 2.5 million shares worth as much as $8.5 billion last year, Bloomberg reported citing regulatory filings. She still holds 14.9 million Amazon shares and has a net worth of $48.3 billion. Scott has donated over $8.6 billion to charities since her divorce from Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos in 2019.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Prioritise job creation, infra development: Mercedes-Benz India to govt
text: Mercedes-Benz India in its Budget recommendation asked the government to aim at long-term growth for the auto industry prioritising job creation, infrastructure development and introduction of latest technologies. "With stable policies and a clear road map...an accelerated growth can be achieved transitioning the industry swiftly into...e-mobility era," Mercedes-Benz India MD Martin Schwenk said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's exports to China jump 34% from 2019 to $22.9 billion
text: India's exports to China have surged about 34% to $22.9 billion in 2021 from $17.1 billion in 2019, according to Commerce Ministry data. Imports also increased by 28% to $87.5 billion last year compared to $68.4 billion in 2019, the data showed. India's trade deficit with China widened to $64.5 billion in 2021, as per the data.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: No 'Zero Hour' & 'Question Hour' in Parliament on Jan 31, Feb 1
text: Parliament's Budget session will not have 'Zero Hour' and 'Question Hour' on January 31 and February 1 due to the address of President Ram Nath Kovind and presentation of Union Budget 2022. Matters of urgent public importance are raised during the 'Zero Hour', while 'Question Hour' allows MPs to ask questions to ministers.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 38% global emissions caused by construction, operation of buildings: WEF
text: According to the World Economic Forum, the construction and operation of buildings are responsible for 38% of global emissions. There's an urgent need for solutions to help accelerate decarbonisation of the urban-built environment to limit the global temperature rise to below 1.5°C, the forum said. WEF also noted that there's an urgent need to accelerate investment to implement these solutions.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: It has been a roller coaster ride: DIPAM Secy on Air India sale
text: Speaking about the official hand over of Air India to the Tata Group, DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said, "I feel very relieved today; it has been a roller coaster ride with legal challenges." He said Devas Multimedia had emerged as one of the main hurdles for the deal. Devas had dubbed the airline "alter ego" of India, he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Air India will regain lost place in domestic, int'l skies: Scindia
text: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia wished Tata Group, the new owners of Air India, the very best and said, "I'm very confident that under their stewardship and leadership...they will make a great success of Air India." Scindia told Hindustan Times, "Air India will regain its lost place not only in our domestic skies, but in international skies as well."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt plans $40 bn for food, fertiliser subsidy in Budget: Report
text: The government is planning to set aside about ₹3 lakh crore ($40 billion) on food and fertiliser subsidies in its Budget for 2022-23, reported Reuters citing sources. About ₹1.1 lakh crore will be allocated to fertiliser subsidies and ₹2 lakh crore to food subsidies, the report said. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is due to present the Budget on February 1.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt allows 2 states to borrow additional ₹7,309 cr for reforms
text: The Finance Ministry granted additional borrowing permission of ₹7,309 crore to Rajasthan and Andhra Pradesh on Friday for undertaking stipulated power sector reforms. The Ministry has allowed Rajasthan to borrow ₹5,186 crore and Andhra Pradesh to take ₹2,123 crore. Apart from these two states, nine other states have also submitted their proposals to the Ministry of Power for additional borrowing.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: EPFO onboards Air India, 7,453 staff to get social security benefits
text: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has onboarded Air India for social security coverage after Tata Group's takeover of the airline. The social security benefits will be provided to around 7,453 Air India employees. These employees will receive an extra 2% employer's contributions in their Provident Fund accounts at 12% of their wages and a guaranteed minimum pension of ₹1,000.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI imposes withdrawal cap of ₹1 lakh on Indian Mercantile Co-op Bank
text: The RBI announced that it has imposed several restrictions on Lucknow-based Indian Mercantile Co-operative Bank including a cap of ₹1 lakh on withdrawals. The bank will not, without its prior approval, grant or renew any loans and advances, or make any investment, RBI said in a statement. The bank will continue to undertake banking business with restrictions, RBI clarified.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: World is awash in capital, rarely been a better time to be entrepreneur: KM Birla
text: Aditya Birla Group's billionaire Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla shared his reflections for 2021-22 and said, "The world is awash in capital and there has perhaps rarely been a better time to be an entrepreneur." He further wrote, "The competition for investment opportunities and the Fear of Missing Out (FOMO) have driven up valuations of many fledgling companies to stratospheric levels."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Google to invest up to $1 billion in Bharti Airtel, buy 1.28% stake
text: Bharti Airtel has announced that Google will invest up to $1 billion in the company as part of its Google for India Digitization Fund. The deal includes $700 million investment to acquire 1.28% stake in Bharti Airtel and up to $300 million towards implementing various commercial agreements. The companies will focus on enabling affordable access to smartphones across price ranges.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Lived in matchbox house in Mumbai which would flood during monsoon: Vineeta Singh
text: Speaking to Humans of Bombay, Sugar Cosmetics co-founder and CEO Vineeta Singh, who appears on Shark Tank India, said, "At 23, I moved to Bombay. I lived in a matchbox house which would flood during monsoon." "My savings were diminishing...But I pushed on," she added. Vineeta further revealed she got a "great job offer" after MBA but she declined it.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Investor once refused to meet me, he wanted to talk business with a man: Vineeta Singh
text: Sugar Cosmetics co-founder and CEO Vineeta Singh, who appears on Shark Tank India, spoke about facing sexism in an interaction with Humans of Bombay. "Once, an investor refused to hold a meeting just with me. He wanted to have the business talk with a 'man'," she stated. "I decided to let my work do the talking," said Vineeta.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: There were times when I'd be pumping breast milk & handling office calls: Vineeta Singh
text: Sugar Cosmetics Co-founder and CEO Vineeta Singh, who appears on Shark Tank India, spoke to Humans of Bombay about juggling motherhood and career. "There were times when I'd be pumping breast milk...handling office calls, all the while hoping to not wake my son up," she said. "I walk into...office with...files in one hand and my baby in another," Vineeta added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Bharat Biotech's intranasal COVID-19 vaccine approved for booster dose trials
text: The Drugs Controller General of India on Friday permitted Bharat Biotech to conduct trials for its intranasal COVID-19 booster dose. As per reports, the trials for the first-of-its-kind dose will be conducted at nine different sites in India. Over 1 crore precautionary or booster doses have been administered to the eligible population so far, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said today.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Google increases leave for all employees who give birth to 24 weeks
text: Google on Thursday announced that it has expanded parental leave from 12 weeks to 18 weeks for all employees globally. For employees who give birth, their leave has been hiked from 18 weeks to 24 weeks. The tech major is also increasing employees' paid vacation time to a minimum of 20 days a year, up from 15, starting April 2.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Zuckerberg drops below Warren Buffett on rich list, loses $15 bn this year
text: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett has become richer than Facebook parent Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg again amid a slump in global tech stocks. Zuckerberg's fortune has fallen by $15.2 billion to $110 billion in 2022 so far, according to Bloomberg. Meanwhile, Buffett's fortune has surged by $2.4 billion this year to $111 billion, making him the world's sixth richest person.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No plans to build our own smartphone device: Bharti Airtel CEO
text: Bharti Airtel has no plans to build their own smartphone device, the company's CEO for India and South Asia Gopal Vittal said. On Friday, Bharti Airtel announced that Google will invest up to $1 billion in the company, including $700 million for a 1.28% stake. Speaking about Google's investment in Bharti Airtel, Vittal said there's "absolutely zero conflict of interest".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk calls Biden a 'sock puppet', says he's treating Americans like 'fools'
text: World's richest person Elon Musk said Joe Biden is a "damp sock puppet in human form" after the US President left Tesla out of a discussion about electric vehicle production. "Companies like General Motors and Ford are building more electric vehicles here at home than ever before," Biden said. In another tweet, Musk said, "Biden is treating...American public like fools."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Over $100 billion wiped off Tesla's market value in 1 day
text: Tesla shares dropped by around 12% in a single day on Thursday, wiping out $109 billion off its valuation. This in shares came after Tesla announced its fourth-quarter earnings and near future outlook, with CEO Elon Musk stating that the company would not bring any new vehicles to market this year.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Syndicate of 275 firms involved in fake invoices worth ₹3,189 cr busted
text: GST officers from the Ghaziabad Regional Unit of the Directorate of Goods and Service Tax Intelligence (DGGI) busted a syndicate of 275 firms involved in fake invoices worth ₹3,189 crore which led to a GST evasion of ₹362 crore. The officers searched two office premises from where various incriminating documents related to over 200 fake firms were recovered.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Tata Sons Chairman meets Sitharaman, thanks her for Air India takeover
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran met Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday and thanked her "for the successful closure of the Air India transaction". Tata Group acquired 100% stake in Air India from the government after 69 years by bidding ₹18,000 crore. Prior to the official takeover, Chandrasekaran met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on Thursday.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: This isn't the way you run airlines: SC to SpiceJet on Credit Suisse dues
text: Credit Suisse AG informed the Supreme Court that SpiceJet's current offer over pending dues "isn't even worth mentioning". SC asked SpiceJet, "Do you want to run the show or close it? This isn't the way you can run your airlines. What's your contribution?" After the airline said it's "working something out", court stayed SpiceJet's winding up order for three weeks.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Dear guests, welcome aboard this historic flight: Air India's message for flyers today
text: Passengers travelling aboard Air India flights today will be hearing a new in-flight announcement by pilots before departure, as per an official order that followed Tata Group's takeover. The announcement will be as follows: "Dear guests...Welcome aboard this historic flight, which marks a special event. Today, Air India officially becomes a part of...Tata Group again, after seven decades."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Supreme Court stays SpiceJet winding up order for 3 weeks
text: The Supreme Court on Friday stayed the publication of Madras High Court's order on winding up of SpiceJet for three weeks. However, it pulled up the airline over the non-payment of $24 million to Credit Suisse AG and asked it to submit details of its financial status. "Both parties are already in advanced discussions to settle the matter," SpiceJet said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I was a young TCS intern then: Tata Sons Chairman on his 1st Air India flight in 1986
text: After taking over Air India, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran wrote on LinkedIn that his first flight was on Air India in December 1986. "I was a young intern then, at Tata Consultancy Services. I vividly recall, even after all this time, how I felt that day," he added. He said he was excited and "it was a special experience".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bad bank gets all approvals, ₹50,000 crore assets to be transferred initially
text: SBI Chairman Dinesh Khara has announced that all requisite approvals to commence operations of National Asset Reconstruction Company (NARCL) and India Debt Resolution Company (IDRCL) have been received. In the initial phase, 15 cases worth ₹50,000 crore will be transferred to the proposed bad bank this fiscal. Public sector banks will have a majority stake in NARCL, Khara said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Toyota remains world's biggest carmaker as it sells 10.5 mn vehicles in 2021
text: Toyota Motor sold 10.5 million vehicles in 2021, making it the world's biggest carmaker for a second straight year. The company said that the vehicle sales included those by its affiliates Daihatsu Motors and Hino Motors. Volkswagen, which ranked second in the world in vehicle sales, delivered 8.9 million vehicles last year, marking its lowest sales figures in 10 years.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SoftBank COO to leave firm, reportedly after pay dispute with CEO
text: SoftBank Group has said its COO, Marcelo Claure, is leaving the firm. The exit comes after dispute with Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son over his pay, Reuters reported citing sources. Claure had been in talks to leave SoftBank for several months and may launch his own investment firm. Claure's deputy, Michel Combes, has been appointed SoftBank Group International's CEO.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Canadian truckers rule: Musk as drivers protest COVID-19 vaccine mandate
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk voiced his support for Canadian truck drivers protesting against the country's COVID-19 vaccine mandate for cross-border truck drivers. "Canadian truckers rule," Musk tweeted. In a recent interview with TIME magazine, Musk said that while he and his eligible children are vaccinated, he opposes vaccine mandates and called them an "erosion of freedom".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's gold demand surged 78.6% to 797 tonnes in 2021: WGC
text: India's gold consumption surged by 78.6% to 797.3 tonnes in 2021 compared to 446.4 tonnes during 2020, according to the World Gold Council. "The spurt in demand...is less likely to be repeated this year, though the revival will continue to set a new normal," WGC's India MD Somasundaram PR said. The jewellery demand in India surged 93% in 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Vedant Fashions fixes price band for IPO at ₹824-₹866 per share
text: Ethnic wear brand Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹824-₹866 per share. The issue is an offer for sale of 3,63,64,838 shares and the company will raise ₹3,150 crore at the upper price band. Vedant Fashions' IPO will be the third public issue of 2022 and will open for subscription on February 4.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adani Wilmar's ₹3,600-crore IPO fully subscribed on day 2
text: The ₹3,600-crore IPO of Adani Wilmar was fully subscribed on the second day of bidding as it received bids for 13.05 crore shares against an offer size of 12.25 crore shares. The portion of the IPO reserved for retail investors was subscribed 1.76 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was booked 0.84 times as of 4 pm on Friday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: US corporate body congratulates Tata Group for 'homecoming' of Air India
text: The US-India Business Council has congratulated Tata Group for the "homecoming" of Air India and commended the Indian government for its asset monetisation programme. Meanwhile, US-India Strategic and Partnership Forum's President Mukesh Aghi wrote, "A milestone moment for Tata Companies. Congratulations to Chairman N Chandrasekaran and...Tata Group." Tata took over Air India after 69 years.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Take action to address inefficiencies in banking sector: USISPF to govt
text: The US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) in its Budget recommendations asked government to take urgent action to address the distortions and inefficiencies arising out of regulatory mandates in banking sector. Its other suggestions included a commitment to global tax norms, specific steps to promote digital solutions like developing inter-operable QR codes and digitising B2B payments.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: H&M reports $640 mn profit in Q4, aims to double sales by 2030
text: Swedish fashion group H&M reported a 64% jump in its pre-tax profit to $640 million in the fourth quarter compared to the same period last year. The company said that it will increase its investments to about $10 billion in 2022 with the aim of doubling sales by 2030. After the announcement, H&M's shares rose by 5% in early trade.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Budget should boost demand by offering tax reliefs to households: Report
text: India's Budget should focus on supporting the pandemic-hit economy and boost consumption demand by offering income tax reliefs and lowering taxes on oil products, a report by India Ratings said. The report expects the government to delay fiscal consolidation and make it a gradual and calibrated process. The report also called for setting pragmatic disinvestment targets.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Air India officially handed over to Tata Group after 69 years
text: Air India was officially handed over to Tata Group on Thursday, nearly 69 years after its nationalisation. Ahead of the handover, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran met PM Narendra Modi. Tata Group won the bid to buy the airline, which it founded in 1932, for ₹18,000 crore. It has completed a cash payment of ₹2,700 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Maha passes proposal to allow wine sale at supermarkets & walk-in stores
text: Maharashtra Cabinet passed a proposal to allow selling wine at supermarkets and walk-in stores. The stores' area should be over 1,000 square feet and should be registered under Maharashtra Shops and Establishments Act. However, those near places of worship won't be allowed to sell wine. Condemning the move, former CM Devendra Fadnavis said, "We won't allow Maharashtra to become 'Madya'Rashtra."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Covaxin, Covishield vaccines given 'conditional' market approval by DCGI
text: Covaxin and Covishield COVID-19 vaccines have received conditional market authorisation from DCGI. Earlier, CDSCO committee recommended upgradation of the status from restricted use in emergency situations with conditions in adults. The authorisation is conditional to submission of ongoing clinical trial data of the vaccine on a six-monthly basis or as and when available, whichever is earlier.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm deeply grateful to the President, PM & Indians: Pichai on Padma Bhushan
text: Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai, named for the Padma Bhushan award, said, "I am deeply grateful to the Padma Awards Committee, the President and Prime Minister, as well as the people of India." He added, "It's made all the more meaningful to be among this esteemed group of individuals who've had a profound impact on their fields and communities."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Honour to be recognised with so many extraordinary people: Nadella on Padma Bhushan
text: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, named among Padma Bhushan awardees, said it's an honour to receive it and "to be recognised with so many extraordinary people". He wrote on Twitter, "I'm thankful to the President, Prime Minister and people of India." Nadella added that he'll continue working with people across India to "help them use technology to achieve more".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Air India will bloom under their wings: Aviation Minister as Tata Group takes over
text: After Air India was officially handed over to Tata Group, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said, "Best wishes to the new owners. I am confident...the airline will bloom under their wings." Tata Group won the bid to buy the airline for ₹18,000 crore. "This proves the govt's ability and...resolve to carry out disinvestment effectively in non-strategic sectors," Scindia tweeted.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No halwa ceremony before Budget, staff due for 'lock-in' at workplace get sweets
text: Sweets were provided to core staff due for 'lock-in' at their work workplace instead of the customary halwa ceremony ahead of the Union Budget 2022-23 amid COVID-19. To maintain the secrecy of the Budget, there's a 'lock-in' of officials involved in making the Budget. Budget Press in North Block houses officials in the period leading up to the Budget presentation.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tata Sons Chairman meets PM Modi before official takeover of Air India
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi on Thursday ahead of Tata Group's official takeover of Air India. The Prime Minister's Office shared a picture of their meeting on Twitter. In October, Tata Group won the bid to acquire Air India for ₹18,000 crore. It will be taking over the airline after nearly 69 years.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Delighted Air India is back, will create a world-class airline: Tata Sons Chairman
text: After officially taking over Air India, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran said, "We're totally delighted that this process is complete and happy to have Air India back in the Tata Group." "We look forward to working with everyone to create a world-class airline," he added. Tata Group acquired 100% stake in Air India from the government by bidding ₹18,000 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Your arrival was much awaited: Tata as Air India returns to the group after 69 yrs
text: Tata Group in a tweet said, "Your arrival was much awaited, Air India," after the airline returned to the group after 69 years on Thursday. Meanwhile, Air India tweeted, "Two iconic names come together to embark on a voyage of excellence." The airline was founded by JRD Tata in 1932 before being converted into a public company.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No better custodian to restore Air India's old glory: Anand Mahindra on Tata Group
text: Congratulating Tata Group and Air India on their "milestone", Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "Air India is a brand that's part of the nation's treasure trove." "There is no better custodian, from the point of view of both passion and resources to restore its old glory," Mahindra said about Tata Group. Tata took over Air India after 69 years.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Thanks for igniting my spark: Nair on leaving Unilever after 30 yrs to be Chanel CEO
text: Indian-origin Leena Nair, who's leaving Unilever to become Chanel's global CEO, posted a farewell note on Twitter. She wrote, "After thirty years at Unilever, I'm sure you can imagine how hard it is to say goodbye." She called the company "unique and the best place in the world for developing leaders," while adding, "Thank you for igniting my spark."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tata Sons Chairman writes to Air India employees, says entire nation's eyes are on us
text: In his first communication to Air India employees after taking over the airline, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran said, "Entire nation's eyes are on us, waiting to see what we'll achieve together." "I am convinced that the golden age of Air India lies ahead. Our journey towards it starts now," he added. "Welcome. And welcome back," he told the employees.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Apple posts all-time revenue record of $123.9 bn in Dec-quarter
text: Apple, in its fiscal 2022 first quarter ended December 25, posted an all-time revenue record of $123.9 billion, up 11% year-over-year. Its profit was $34.6 billion, compared to $28.7 billion in the year-ago period. iPads sales fell 14% to $7.25 billion compared with analyst estimates of $8.2 billion, while iPhone revenue rose 9% year-on-year to $71.63 billion.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Electronic goods exports surge 49% YoY to $11 bn in April-Dec 2021
text: India's electronic goods exports surged 49% YoY to $11 billion in the April-December 2021 period, the Commerce Ministry's data showed on Thursday. India exported electronic goods worth $7.4 billion in the same period in 2020. Exports rose to $1.67 billion in December 2021, a 33.99% YoY growth from $1.25 billion in December 2020.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Renault-Nissan share plan to spend $26 billion on EVs in next 5 yrs
text: Renault and Nissan on Thursday shared detailed plans to spend $26 billion on electric vehicles over the next five years and said they will work more closely together to make electric cars. The companies also plan to increase the number of common platforms for EVs to five from four and build a combined EV line-up of 35 vehicles by 2030.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Right time for India to review fiscal, monetary policy: Uday Kotak
text: Ahead of the Union Budget, Uday Kotak said it's the "right time for India to review its fiscal and monetary policy" after US Federal Reserve indicated that it may raise interest rates in March. Fed rate hike "will shrink balance sheet", he added. The Kotak Mahindra Bank MD further said that India's upcoming Budget and next RBI meeting are crucial.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Income tax refunds worth ₹1.62 lakh crore issued so far in FY22
text: Income Tax department said on Thursday that it has issued refunds worth ₹1.62 lakh crore to 1.79 crore taxpayers so far in FY22. This includes 1.41 crore refunds for FY21. Personal Income Tax refunds of ₹57,754 crore have been issued to over 1.77 crore entities and corporate tax refunds of ₹1.04 lakh crore have been issued in 2.23 lakh cases.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tata offers 'enhanced' meals on flights as 1st move in Air India: Reports
text: The Tata Group has taken its first step in Air India by introducing "enhanced" meal service in four flights operating from Mumbai today (January 27), reports said citing officials. The enhanced meal service will also be introduced at five Mumbai-Delhi flights on Friday, as per reports. Tata is expected to officially take over Air India today after nearly 69 years.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt notifies Air India asset transfer agreement with AIAHL
text: Ahead of Air India's official takeover by Tata Group, the government notified the agreement between the airline and special purpose vehicle AI Assets Holding Limited (AIAHL) for the transfer of non-core assets. The government set up AIAHL in 2019 for holding debt and non-core assets of Air India. Around 75% of Air India's total debt will be transferred to AIAHL.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Karvy Group Chairman and CFO arrested by ED in ₹2,000 crore scam
text: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Karvy Group's Chairman and MD Comandur Parthasarathy and CFO G Hari Krishna in an ongoing ₹2,000 crore security and money laundering case. The accused were allegedly involved in fraud through illegal diversion of clients' securities worth ₹2,873.8 crore and pledging of these securities with banks and NBFCs to seek loans and subsequent loan defaults.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Budget should focus on bridging economic inequality: Ex-RBI Guv
text: Former RBI Governor Dr D Subbarao on Thursday said the Budget should focus on creating jobs and bridging the widened inequality in the economy besides accelerating growth. Citing the World Inequality Report, he said, "Such inequality...will dent our long-term growth prospects." He also opined that export promotion behind protectionist walls is seldom competitive and thus tariffs must be reduced.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tata gets loan commitment from SBI-led consortium for Air India: Reports
text: An SBI-led consortium of lenders has reportedly agreed to provide loans to Tata Group for the smooth operations of its newly acquired airline Air India. The consortium agreed to grant both term loans and working capital loans, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Tata had offered to take over Air India's debt of ₹15,300 crore and pay ₹2,700 crore to the government.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: ICAI flags concerns over provisions of CA Act amendment bill
text: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has submitted a memorandum to the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Finance, raising concerns over provisions of the Chartered Accountants (CA) Act amendment bill. According to ICAI President Nihar N Jambusaria, ICAI's issues include change in the disciplinary committee and proposed coordination committee's leadership.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Retail industry seeks GST reforms, loan moratorium in Budget
text: Retailers Association of India CEO Kumar Rajagopalan said that the retail industry is seeking a more predictable GST regime, along with a loan moratorium for mall owners in the upcoming Budget. "Many clauses around carrying forward and refund of GST need clarification," Rajagopalan added. Retailers are also expecting announcement of the long-pending National Retail Policy.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Future Group to sell 25% stake in insurance JV to Generali for ₹1,253 cr
text: Debt-ridden Future Group will sell its 25% equity in Future Generali India Insurance (FGIICL) to its joint venture partner Generali for a cash consideration of ₹1,252.96 crore, the company said. Generali has also acquired an option to buy out Future Enterprises' remaining interest in FGIICL, directly or through a nominee. Currently, Future Enterprises holds a stake of 49.91% in FGIICL.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Woman stalked Tim Cook, claimed to be his wife & sent pics of loaded gun: Apple
text: Apple has been granted a restraining order against a 45-year-old woman who has allegedly been stalking CEO Tim Cook. She claimed that Cook's her husband and father of her children and emailed him 200 times from October-mid-November 2020, Apple said. The company alleged that she threatened him, sent him photos of a loaded pistol and even trespassed at his home.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: TCS, Infosys in world's 10 most valuable IT services brands listed by Brand Finance
text: Brand valuation consultancy Brand Finance has named Accenture as the world's most valuable IT services brand of 2022 with a valuation of $36.2 billion. It's followed by India's TCS and Infosys with valuations of $16.8 billion and $12.8 billion, respectively. Infosys is followed by IBM, Cognizant, Capgemini, India's Wipro and HCL, and Japan's NTT Data and Fujitsu.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Which are the world's 10 most valuable brands according to Brand Finance?
text: Apple has been named the most valuable brand of 2022 by brand valuation consultancy Brand Finance with a valuation of $355.1 billion. Apple is followed by Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Walmart, Samsung, Facebook, Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Huawei and Verizon. While technology remains the most valuable industry, pharmaceutical is the fastest-growing industry, Brand Finance said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Headphones maker boAt files papers for ₹2,000-crore IPO
text: Imagine Marketing, the parent company of headphones and wearables maker boAt, has filed papers with market regulator SEBI for a ₹2,000-crore IPO. It comprises a fresh issue of shares worth up to ₹900 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹1,100 crore. Aman Gupta and Sameer Mehta, who started the company in 2016, will be diluting their stake.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tata Group to take over Air India today, N Chandrasekaran to meet PM Modi: Reports
text: Tata Group is likely to take over Air India today (January 27), nearly 69 years after it was taken from the conglomerate, reports said. Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran will reportedly be meeting PM Narendra Modi ahead of the handover and Air India's current board will resign. Tata Sons had won the bid to buy the airline for ₹18,000 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: My mentor, my hero: Adar Poonawalla shares old pic as father gets Padma Bhushan
text: Covishield maker Serum Institute's CEO Adar Poonawalla shared a childhood picture with his father Cyrus Poonawalla on Twitter after the government named him as a Padma Bhushan awardee for 2022. Adar wrote, "I thank the government of India for acknowledging my mentor, my hero, my father." He also congratulated all "deserving individuals who will receive the Padma awards this year".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: What are IMF's Gita Gopinath's recommendations for India's Union Budget?
text: IMF's First Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath said that India's Union Budget for 2022-23 should address "the very unequal recovery within the economy". The rural jobs guarantee scheme should remain "well-funded" and the government should extend the free food scheme beyond March 2022, India-born Gopinath told BloombergQuint. Spending on healthcare and education also needs attention, she added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: China to begin 3-year nationwide crackdown on money laundering
text: China will begin a three-year nationwide crackdown to stop money laundering and other related crimes, lasting till December 2024. Eleven government agencies will execute the campaign led by the People's Bank of China and the Ministry of Public Security. In June 2021, China arrested over 1,100 people in a crackdown on the use of cryptocurrencies for money laundering.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: IMF's Gopinath shares video message after her last World Economic Outlook release
text: India-born Gita Gopinath on Tuesday released her last World Economic Outlook as IMF's Chief Economist. "There are numerous challenges facing the global economy...But...global recovery is continuing. Let's hope that we can make 2022 the year we truly exit the pandemic," she said in a video message on Twitter. Gopinath is taking up the role of IMF's First Deputy Managing Director.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: James Murdoch, Uday Shankar to buy 40% stake in Reliance's Viacom18: Report
text: Billionaire James Murdoch and ex-Star and Disney India Chairman Uday Shankar plan to acquire nearly 40% stake in Viacom18, ET reported citing sources. Murdoch, Shankar, Reliance Industries and other investors plan to infuse ₹12,000 crore in the business, the report said. Reliance Industries-owned Network18 has 51% stake in Viacom18, while ViacomCBS owns 49% stake in the joint venture.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: How much wealth have world's 10 richest people lost amid global market selloff?
text: World's 10 richest people have lost a combined $158 billion from their wealth amid a global market selloff this month, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. World's richest person Elon Musk's fortune shrunk by $33 billion, while Jeff Bezos' fortune fell by $27 billion. Warren Buffett is the only person among them who gained. His net worth increased by $2.6 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Barbie maker Mattel wins rights to make Disney Princess toys after 6 years
text: Barbie maker Mattel has won the rights to produce dolls based on Disney's princess characters, including Frozen's Elsa. Its rival Hasbro took over the Disney Princess and Frozen license in 2016 after Mattel had been making the toys for 20 years. "This is a defining moment in our transformation," CEO Ynon Kreiz said, without revealing the deal's financial terms.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,000 points in early trade, falls below 57,000-mark
text: The Sensex crashed over 1,000 points during early trade on Thursday amid weak global cues and a possibility of rate hikes by US Federal Reserve from March. The Sensex fell below the 57,000-mark, while the broader Nifty 50 plunged around 300 points to fall below the 17,000-mark. Tata Steel, Titan, Tech Mahindra were among top losers on the Sensex.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tesla reports $2.32 bn in Q4 profit, to launch no new model this yr
text: Tesla has reported a net income of $2.32 billion in the fourth quarter, up 760% year-on-year. Its revenue rose by 65% year-on-year to $17.72 billion in the quarter, beating analyst estimates of $16.57 billion. Tesla CEO Elon Musk in the earnings call said the firm will not be introducing new vehicle models this year due to supply chain issues.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: A truly global leader: Pai as Tata Sons' Chandrasekaran gets Padma Bhushan
text: Ex-Infosys CFO TV Mohandas Pai has congratulated Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran on being awarded Padma Bhushan, calling him "a truly global leader". "He is a great Patriot, nationalist and has worked hard to put India on the global map always!" he added. Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella are also among the recipients of Padma Bhushan.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bentley to invest $3.4 billion to exclusively offer EVs by 2030
text: Luxury carmaker Bentley will spend over $3.4 billion over the next decade to become a fully electric luxury brand by 2030. Bentley said it will start production of its first fully-electric car in 2025. The investment will include research and development and significant upgrades to Bentley's plant manufacturing campus in Crewe, England, through 2032.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Aluminium association seeks to hike customs duty on scrap to 10% in Budget
text: Ahead of the Union Budget, Aluminium Association of India (AAI) has sought an increase of customs duty on aluminium scrap from 2.5% to 10% citing that country's consumption of scrap is "100% import-dependent". The association said the duty increase will encourage recycling of domestic scrap and reduce the share of scrap in total imports, which stood at 66% in 2020-21.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: ₹70,000-crore investment proposals achieved within a year: J&K LG
text: Jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha said that target of investment proposals worth ₹70,000 crore has been achieved within a year. "The global investors exhibited keen interest in investing in J&K, and investment proposals worth ₹3,000 crore were finalised in a short span of two days," Sinha added while highlighting the investments attracted by J&K at the Dubai Expo.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Petroleum industry body seeks to bring natural gas under GST
text: The government must bring natural gas under the GST regime to realise PM Narendra Modi's vision of a gas-based economy, the Federation of Indian Petroleum Industry (FIPI) said in its pre-Budget memorandum. GST on transportation of natural gas through pipeline must be rationalised and import duty on LNG must be lowered to make it competitive with other fuels, FIPI said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Gems, jewellery exports up by 71% during Apr-Dec to $28.9 billion
text: Gems and jewellery exports grew by 71% during April-December 2021 to $28.9 billion as compared to $16.9 billion in the same period last year, as per Commerce Ministry's data. The exports grew by 16.38% to $2.99 billion in December 2021, the data showed. US, Hong Kong, UAE, Belgium and Israel were the top five export destinations for the sector.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Continuation of near-term income support measures a must in Budget: CRISIL
text: CRISIL research said the government must continue budgetary support on incomes in Budget 2022 to strengthen household consumption demand. "Delaying a sharp fiscal correction to make room for boosting employment, infrastructure spending is probably the best bet at this juncture," CRISIL said. It added that the Centre can create additional fiscal space of ₹35 lakh crore over fiscals 2022-2026.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bengaluru 1st choice for returning NRIs to buy home, Pune 2nd: Survey
text: Bengaluru has topped the choice of non-resident Indians looking to buy residential properties in India, as per a survey conducted by ANAROCK Property Consultants. Of the overall respondents, 22% preferred Bengaluru, 18% preferred Pune, while 17% preferred Chennai. Half of NRI respondents preferred luxury properties priced above ₹1.5 crore and 32% favoured premium properties starting from ₹90 lakh.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Banks ask govt to scrap quarterly issuance of TDS certificate in Budget
text: Indian Banks' Association (IBA) recommended the government to scrap quarterly issuance of Tax Deducted at the Source (TDS) certificates (Form 16A) and allow the issuance annually to cut banks' compliance burden. Under its Budget suggestions, IBA sought the setting up of special dispute resolution mechanism to cut litigations between banks and tax department. It also sought relief from GST notices.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Adani Wilmar raises ₹940 cr from 15 anchor investors ahead of IPO
text: Ahead of its IPO's rollout, Adani Wilmar on Tuesday said that it has garnered ₹940 crore from 15 anchor investors. The edible oil major has finalised allocation of 4.08 crore equity shares to anchor investors at a price of ₹230 per share, the company added in its BSE filing. Adani Wilmar's ₹3,600-crore IPO will open for subscription on January 27.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Insurers seek high investment limit, GST reduction in Budget
text: Insurance companies are seeking a separate deduction limit of ₹1 lakh for insurance premium payment under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act in the upcoming Budget. Insurers are also seeking reduction in GST on health insurance products from 18% to 5% to make them affordable. They are also seeking doubling of medical insurance limit under Section 80D to ₹50,000.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Crude oil prices hit 7-year high following rising Russia-Ukraine tensions
text: Benchmark oil prices touched their highest levels since 2014 as escalating geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine added to possibility of supply disruptions. Brent crude rose $1.37, or 1.6%, to $89.57/barrel after reaching $89.60/barrel, the highest since October 2014, earlier today. US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude was up $1.13, or 1.3%, to $86.73/barrel.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sterlite Tech bags multi-year order worth ₹170 cr from Power Grid
text: Sterlite Technologies announced that it has bagged a multi-year order of about ₹170 crore to build a unified network management system for Power Grid Corporation of India. The broadband technology company will also provide a consolidated infrastructure with centralised controls for their inter-regional networks. Sterlite said it has already been supplying optical fibre cables to Power Grid.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Pfizer and BioNTech begin clinical trial of Omicron-based COVID-19 vaccine
text: Pfizer and BioNTech on Tuesday announced the initiation of a clinical study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and immunogenicity of an Omicron-based vaccine candidate. The study will evaluate up to 1,420 healthy adults aged between 18 and 55. The study will have three cohorts examining different regimens of the current Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine or an Omicron-based vaccine.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I will eat a happy meal on TV if McDonald's accepts Dogecoin: Musk
text:
World's richest person Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "I will eat a happy meal on tv if 
McDonald's accepts Dogecoin." Hours ago, McDonald's Twitter account, in an apparent dig at falling crypto prices, had tweeted, "How are you doing people who run crypto Twitter accounts?" Earlier this month, Musk had announced that Dogecoin could be used to buy Tesla merchandise.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amazon worker records alleged sexual harassment she faces at warehouse on TikTok
text: An Amazon packer alleged that she is routinely sexually harassed by male colleagues at the warehouse where she works and posted a TikTok video about it. The video, which went viral, showed the comments she received while working, which included "Let's chill on break" and "Ayye what's your name". Some users claimed they faced similar incidents at Amazon.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Satya Nadella and Sundar Pichai awarded Padma Bhushan
text: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai are among the awardees of Padma Bhushan this year. Serum Institute of India MD Cyrus Poonawalla and Bharat Biotech Founders Dr Krishna Ella and Suchitra Ella have also been named among the awardees. A total of 17 people have been awarded the Padma Bhushan this year.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: IMF releases world economic outlook, cuts India's FY22 growth forecast to 9%
text: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Tuesday released its latest world economic outlook growth projections and cut India's FY22 economic growth forecast to 9% from 9.5%. It put the growth forecast for India for 2022-23 at 9% and 7.1% in 2022-24. IMF's 2022 global growth projection is 4.4%, lower than previously forecasted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Will be dealt with urgency: Mahindra as farmer told 'you won't have ₹10' at showroom
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has responded after a farmer in Karnataka was allegedly insulted at a Mahindra showroom and was told, "You won't even have ₹10." Mahindra tweeted that one of the company's key core values is to uphold the dignity of the individual. "Any aberration from this philosophy will be addressed with great urgency," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Vijay Kedia sells rights to the jingle 'BSE Meri Jaan Ho Tum' to BSE for ₹1
text: Vijay Kedia, a long-term investor and Founder of Kedia Securities, sold the rights of his jingle 'BSE Meri Jaan Ho Tum' to BSE for ₹1. "From my first failed attempt in 1989 to become a sub-broker at BSE to today where my voice becomes a part of this great institution, the journey is both overwhelming and an honour," Kedia said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who are the recipients of the Padma Awards 2022 in the business field?
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran, Covaxin maker Bharat Biotech's Krishna Ella and Suchitra Ella and Covishield maker Serum Institute's Founder Cyrus Poonawalla are among Padma Bhushan awardees in the business field for 2022. Padma Shri awardees are Jagjit Singh Dardi, Muktamani Devi, Japan's Ryuko Hira and Rupa & Co's Prahlad Rai Agarwala.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Future Group challenges lenders in SC to stop being named a defaulter: Report
text: Future Group has challenged its own lenders in Supreme Court to avoid being declared a defaulter for missing payments, citing its dispute with Amazon, reported Reuters. Earlier this month, Future Retail had missed the due date to pay ₹3,494.56 crore to various lenders. It has asked the court to order lenders to grant more time to execute retail asset sale.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Dogecoin jumps after Musk urges McDonald's to accept it as payment
text: Dogecoin jumped as much as 8% on Tuesday after the world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk urged McDonald's to start accepting the meme-inspired cryptocurrency for payment. "I will eat a happy meal on tv if McDonald's accepts Dogecoin," Musk had tweeted. McDonald's rival Burger King responded to Musk's tweet saying, "Only a king knows what da coin do."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: File FIR against Amazon over Indian flag themed goods: MP govt to DGP
text: Madhya Pradesh government has directed the police to register an FIR against Amazon officials and its owner for allegedly selling products featuring the Indian flag. "It's intolerable that even it (the national flag) has been used on shoes," Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. Earlier, social media users criticised Amazon for selling such products and sought a ban on these items.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SHEIN revives plan to list in New York this year: Report
text: Chinese fashion retailer SHEIN is reviving plans to list in New York this year, Reuters reported. According to the report, SHEIN's Chinese Founder Chris Xu is also considering a citizenship change partly to bypass China's new and tougher rules on overseas listings. Founded in 2008, SHEIN had started preparing for US IPO two years ago but later shelved the plan.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: MakeMyTrip's Kalra moves on from exec role, to be Group Chairman
text: MakeMyTrip's Co-founder Deep Kalra is moving on from his executive role as the Group Executive Chairman, the company said in a US SEC filing. Kalra will be assuming the role of Chief Mentor and Group Chairman, effective April 1, 2022. In his new role, "Kalra will devote his time in providing mentorship to MakeMyTrip's leadership team", the company said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Maruti Suzuki India profit falls 48% on chip crunch, high input costs
text: Maruti Suzuki India recorded a 48% drop in its net profit in the third-quarter, as a global chip shortage slowed production and high raw material costs squeezed profit margins. Its profit stood at ₹1,012 crore compared with ₹1,941 crore a year earlier. The firm said it could not produce an estimated 90,000 units due to chip shortage.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: FIR filed against Shopee for allegedly selling fake products in UP
text: Uttar Pradesh police have filed an FIR against Singapore-headquartered e-commerce platform Shopee and its executives for allegedly selling counterfeit products. The FIR was filed following a complaint by a man alleging that the three products he bought from Shopee in December turned out to be duplicate. "The sale of counterfeit items...is strictly prohibited on our platform," Shopee said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: OYO to submit revised draft document for ₹8,430-cr IPO to SEBI: Report
text: Hospitality major OYO is ready to file a revised draft document with SEBI as it moves ahead with its ₹8,430-crore IPO, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. The company has reportedly received in-principle approval from BSE and NSE. Earlier, Federation of Hotel and Restaurant Associations of India alleged that OYO concealed information about criminal proceedings against it in its IPO papers.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Restaurant industry seeks input tax credit, cheaper loans in Budget
text: The pandemic-hit restaurant industry has sought restoration of the input tax credit, cheaper loans, and increased emergency credit line in Budget 2022-23. Restaurant owners and founders told ET that several restaurants may have to shut down if input tax credit is not extended. Restaurant industry expects government to throw a lifeline to the sector and protect jobs, they added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: TPCI seeks support measures for food, beverage industry in Budget
text: Trade Promotion Council of India (TPCI) said it seeks duty-free import of raw materials by Special Economic Zone units and setting up of modern R&D labs for the food and beverage industry in the upcoming Budget. It also seeks input tax credits, subsidy for testing in the food sector and funds for setting up machinery manufacturing plants for the industry.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Economy has recovered, govt should reduce fiscal deficit: Ex-NITI Aayog VC
text: A week ahead of the Union Budget, NITI Aayog's former Vice-Chairman Arvind Panagariya said that government should now signal its intention to reduce fiscal deficit by cutting it by half-to-one percentage point in 2022-23. ''The Indian economy has recovered handsomely, returning to its pre-COVID-19 GDP...Only private consumption is still below its pre-COVID-19 level,'' Panagariya added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PMC Bank merges with Unity Small Finance Bank
text: Branches of Punjab and Maharashtra Co-operative Bank Ltd (PMC Bank) will operate as Unity Small Finance Bank Ltd (USFBL) branches from Tuesday, RBI said in a press release. RBI added that USFBL is making all necessary arrangements to implement provisions of the merger. The bank's amalgamation scheme envisages takeover of the assets and liabilities of PMC Bank.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 445 infrastructure projects face cost overruns of ₹4.4 lakh cr: Govt
text: Over 445 infrastructure projects worth ₹150 crore or more have been affected by cost overruns totalling ₹4.4 lakh crore, according to a government report. Total original cost of implementation of 1,673 projects was ₹22.23 lakh crore and their anticipated completion cost is likely to be ₹26.64 lakh crore, the report said. Of the 1,673 projects, 557 were delayed.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cipla's profit after tax falls 2.6% YoY to ₹729 crore in Q3
text: Cipla Limited on Tuesday reported a consolidated profit after tax (PAT) of ₹729 crore in Q3 FY22, a 2.6% YoY decrease from ₹748 crore in Q3 FY21. Cipla reported PAT of ₹711 crore in Q2 FY22. The company's revenue in Q3 FY22 stood at ₹5,479 crore, a 6% YoY increase as compared with ₹5,169 crore in Q3 FY21.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: JSW Steel to spend over $1 billion to cut carbon emissions
text: JSW Steel has earmarked $1.3 billion to reduce carbon emissions and will shift to solar power for energy and use more scrap, joint MD Seshagiri Rao said. It's also in talks with GAIL India for supply of natural gas to its biggest mill. JSW Steel aims to reduce emissions to 1.95 tons for every ton of steel produced by 2030.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Unilever to cut 1,500 management jobs under organisational revamp
text: Unilever announced plans to cut about 1,500 jobs this week as a part of its organisational restructuring. The Dove soap and Magnum ice cream maker will cut 15% of senior management roles and 5% of junior management roles. Unilever will now be organised into five business segments that are beauty and wellbeing, personal care, home care, nutrition and ice cream.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: LIC reports profit after tax of ₹1,437 crore in first half of FY22
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) reported profit after tax of ₹1,437 crore in the April-September 2021 period. Its profit after tax in the same period in 2020 was ₹6.14 crore. LIC said its new business premium growth rate stood at 554.1% in H1 FY22, up from 394.76% in H1 FY21.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tencent fires 70 employees in 2021 amid campaign against fraud
text: Chinese technology company Tencent sacked 70 employees as part of a campaign against fraud in 2021, CNBC reported on Tuesday. Tencent's recent report of internal investigations said the company identified cases of embezzlement and bribery and took action accordingly. Tencent added it has reported some of the sacked employees to the authorities.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Inflation driven by supply shortage, not excess demand: Report
text: A report by investment management company BlackRock has determined that inflation is being driven by a shortage of supply rather than excess demand. It found that this trend will "likely bring more macro volatility and force policymakers to live with higher inflation". It added that economy-wide and sector-specific supply constraints are pushing inflation higher.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 5 richest tech billionaires collectively lose $85 billion of wealth in Jan
text: World's five richest tech billionaires collectively lost $85.07 billion of their wealth in the first few weeks of 2022, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. While Elon Musk lost about $26.9 billion, Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' wealth declined by $24.7 billion in 2022. Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates and Google Co-founder Larry Page's wealth dropped by $9.5 billion and $11.9 billion, respectively.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla countersues JPMorgan over deal affected by Musk's tweet
text: Tesla has countersued JPMorgan over a disputed deal affected by Elon Musk's 2018 tweet where he said he might take Tesla private. The lawsuit accused JPMorgan of filing "cynical litigation" when the bank sued Tesla last year, claiming it was owed $162 million when Tesla stock warrants expired. Tesla said JPMorgan "pressed its exorbitant demand as an act of retaliation".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Zomato, Paytm, Nykaa shares drop to record lows, Zomato share price slips below ₹100
text: The shares of Paytm, Zomato, Policybazaar and Nykaa on Monday fell to their record lows since their market debuts last year, TechCrunch reported. The share price of Zomato dropped below ₹100 for the first time. The fifth straight session of losses has seen Zomato slip 25% during the period, wiping out around ₹26,000 crore of investor wealth, Moneycontrol reported.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Swiggy surpasses rival Zomato's valuation after $700 million funding
text: Food and grocery delivery platform Swiggy has surpassed its rival Zomato's valuation after it raised $700 million in a new funding round. The round valued Swiggy at around $10.7 billion, as per reports. Meanwhile, Zomato's market value fell below $10 billion on Monday after its shares slipped below the ₹100-mark for the first time since its listing.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Swiggy raises $700 million, doubles valuation in 6 months to $10.7 billion
text: Swiggy has closed a $700 million funding round led by Invesco, doubling its valuation in six months to $10.7 billion. The previous fundraise took place in July 2021 when Swiggy was valued at $5.5 billion. "This fundraise will enable Swiggy to further accelerate growth on the core platform and make meaningful investments to grow Instamart," Swiggy said in a statement.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Pumped to know world champ is desi: Mahindra as Manipuri breaks push-up record
text: After 24-year-old Thounaojam Niranjoy Singh from Manipur created a new Guinness World Record for the most push-ups in one minute, businessman Anand Mahindra called him a 'source of motivation'. "No Olympic medal for it, but think about how dominant a form of one-upmanship it is around the world...Pumped me up to know the world champ is Desi!" said Mahindra.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Amazon sells masks, cups featuring Indian flag, gets criticised
text: Several users on social media shared screenshots of some products featuring the Indian flag being sold on Amazon. Users shared pictures of masks, apparels and cups, among others, with #AmazonInsultsNationalFlag and sought a ban on these items claiming it as an insult to the flag and a violation of the country's flag code.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Have been waiting for a bear market: Zomato CEO reassures staff amid share price drop
text: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal on Monday sent an email to his employees after its share price slipped record low. He wrote, "I've been waiting for a bear market…This is the thing about stock market…We had no control over our valuation going up from $8 billion in the IPO to $17 billion at our peak...What we do control is our execution."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Air India likely to be transferred to Tata Group on Jan 27: Report
text: Air India is likely to be handed over to Tata Group on January 27, as per an official of the airline. In a purported email to employees, Air India's Director, Finance, Vinod Hejmadi said the airline’s disinvestment will take place on January 27 and the closing balance sheet as of January 20 will be provided to the Tata Group today.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Will fold up if plea not heard: SpiceJet to Supreme Court on HC's winding up order
text: SpiceJet urged the Supreme Court to hear its petition against Madras High Court's winding up order, saying the airline "will fold up" if case isn't heard. The court then agreed to hear the matter on January 28. The matter pertains to Credit Suisse's plea to wind up SpiceJet over $24-million dues. Earlier, Madras HC stayed its order till January 28.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex crashes over 1,100 points, Nifty near 17,250
text: Sensex fell for a fifth straight session, plunging over 1,100 points to under 58,000, while Nifty was trading at near 17,250. Both the indexes have declined more than 6% since scaling all-time highs in October last year. As many as 28 stocks in the 30-share Sensex benchmark were in the red zone today.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Mukesh Ambani's RIL to launch multi-channel beauty platform 'Tiara': Report
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) is reportedly preparing to launch an omnichannel beauty platform, which is being developed by Fynd and Netmeds. Internally called 'Project Adore', the venture is likely to be named 'Tiara', ET reported citing sources. Reliance Retail has inked agreements with several cosmetic and beauty brands and Isha Ambani is leading the project, the report added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: ₹19.5 lakh crore investor wealth wiped off in 5 trading sessions
text: Around ₹19.5 lakh crore wealth of investors has been wiped off in five trading sessions. Since Tuesday last week, the Sensex has lost over 3,800 points, while the broader Nifty 50 lost over 1,150 points, Moneycontrol reported. On Monday (January 24), the Sensex ended 1,545 points lower, eroding over ₹9 lakh crore wealth of investors in a day.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Told Bezos people don't want to run errands for rich: US comedian
text: US comedian Jon Stewart said he once told Amazon's Jeff Bezos that people want to feel proud of their work, not just run errands for the rich. Stewart said Bezos discussed what he saw as economy of the future, one that would rely on service workers to perform tasks. "He views everybody as like...part of a fulfilment centre," Stewart added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: NPCI testing 'UPI Lite' to allow payments without internet: Report
text: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) is testing a system to facilitate Unified Payments Interface (UPI)-based digital payments without active internet connection, Mint reported. Called 'UPI Lite', the system is likely to be initially used to enable digital payments under ₹200 in rural areas, the report said. The NPCI is testing two methods to make it work, it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Moody's upgrades Tesla's debt rating, says outlook remains positive
text: Moody's upgraded Tesla's debt rating by two notches to "Ba1" from "Ba3" on Monday. It said in a note that Tesla's outlook remains positive and the company will continue to increase its scale rapidly and improve its profitability notably. Tesla is expected to deliver nearly 1.4 million vehicles this year, up from about 936,000 in 2021, Moody's said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Supertech says advance payment made for Noida twin towers demolition
text: Supertech has said that it has made an advance payment to Mumbai-based Edifice Engineering to carry out the demolition of its 40-storey twin towers in Noida. It has also shared details of the demolition agreement with the New Okhla Industrial Development Authority (NOIDA). Earlier, the Supreme Court had directed Supertech to execute the contract with Edifice Engineering within a week.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions gets SEBI's approval for IPO
text: Vedant Fashions, which owns ethnic wear brands like Manyavar, has received SEBI's approval to raise funds via an IPO. According to the draft papers filed by the company in September last year, the issue comprises a pure offer for sale of up to 36.36 million shares. The IPO will open for subscription on February 4 and close on February 8.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CII seeks measures to step up demand, boost jobs in Budget
text: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) said it is looking forward to a "growth-oriented Budget which would rejuvenate demand, facilitate private investments, and boost job creation while not losing sight of fiscal management". "The Budget is being presented at a time when the economy is at a turning point and recovery has already established its foothold," the industry body said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SEPC looks to target $300 billion services exports in 2022-23
text: The Services Export Promotion Council is looking to set a services export target of $300 billion for 2022-23 expecting resumption of regular international travel and other business activities. SEPC Chairman Sunil Talati said services exports would reach $240 billion by end of FY22. "Important to work towards...change in perception and giving services equal importance as manufacturing," he said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Axis Bank reports 224% YoY rise in net profit to ₹3,614 cr in Q3
text: Axis Bank reported a 224% YoY rise in net profit to ₹3,614 crore in the October-December 2021 quarter. The bank also reported a 17% YoY rise in net interest income to ₹8,653 crore. "The Bank holds cumulative provisions of ₹13,404 crore at the end of Q3," Axis Bank said in a filing.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Barclays offers CEO £6,550 a month allowance to move to London: Report
text: Barclays is offering its CEO CS Venkatakrishnan £6,550 (over ₹6.6 lakh) a month in housing allowance to encourage him to shift from New York to London, reported Sunday Times. The allowance is in addition to Venkatakrishnan's annual pay of £2.7 million. It will reportedly be paid to accommodation provider until October 2023, or until his family is able to relocate.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Education sector seeks GST cut, focus on online education in Budget
text: Firms working in the education sector seek focus on online education and its infrastructure, sufficient funds to improve internet connectivity and reduction in GST on educational services from 18% to 5% in the upcoming Budget. They also seek the opening of schools in batches while following COVID-19 appropriate behaviour and stronger adoption of the blended learning model.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Exporters seek support measures in Budget 2022 to boost shipments
text: Federation of Indian Export Organisations (FIEO) said that exporters have demanded support measures like high import duty on plastic finished goods and setting up of an Indian shipping line for the upcoming Budget to promote shipments. They have also suggested fiscal incentives to address logistics challenges, and reduction of income tax on limited liability partnerships to support MSMEs.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's electronics production likely to reach $300 bn by 2026: Report
text: India Cellular and Electronics Association (ICEA) said in a report that India's electronics production is expected to touch $300 billion by 2026. The National Policy on Electronics (NPE) 2019 had set a target of $400 billion by 2025 for the industry. The report said that the industry will be unable to achieve the target due to adverse impact of COVID-19.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Hong Kong billionaire loses half of her fortune in days amid China probe
text: Hong Kong-based Huabao International's billionaire CEO Chu Lam Yiu's wealth declined by 50% as shares of her company plunged 67% after a Chinese city's supervisory committee began probe into Chu for suspected disciplinary violations. Her net worth stood at $2.6 billion on Monday, down from $5.5 billion on Friday. Huabao provides flavours and fragrances for tobacco, food, personal-care products.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's fuel demand recovery to continue in Q4 FY22: Fitch
text: India's fuel demand will continue to recover through Q4 of FY22 due to easing COVID-19-related restrictions boosting economic activity, Fitch Ratings said on Monday. It added that strong prices are expected to improve the financial profiles of upstream oil and gas companies. "We expect improved demand for petroleum products to reach pre-pandemic levels," Fitch said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We didn't expect this kind of popularity: Dolo-650 maker after several memes amid COVID
text: After several people shared memes about Dolo-650 amid rise in COVID-19 cases, the tablet's maker Micro Labs Limited MD Dilip Surana said, "We did not expect the kind of popularity that Dolo-650 gained recently." "Fever and body pain have been the main symptoms of COVID, for which Dolo-650 proved to be the right remedy," Surana added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Baby X is just like this: Musk on video of ape shared by Tamil Nadu IAS officer
text: World's richest person Elon Musk responded to a video that showed an ape playing with straws, saying, "Baby X [Musk's son] is just like this haha." The video was tweeted in 2020 by Tamil Nadu IAS officer Supriya Sahu. A Twitter account recently re-shared it saying, "This...is a brilliant example of how play is...shared by great apes and humans."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon says Samara ready to buy Future Retail assets for ₹7,000 cr: Report
text: Amazon has reportedly told the independent directors of Future Retail that Samara Capital "remains interested and committed" in investing ₹7,000 crore to buy all retail assets of the debt-ridden company, PTI reported. Earlier, Future Retail's independent directors had sought ₹3,500 crore in unsecured long-term loan from Amazon to help avoid its debt from being classified as non-performing assets.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: He's a professor of management: Mahindra on viral auto driver with fridge, TV in auto
text: Reacting to video of viral auto-rickshaw driver Anna Durai, Anand Mahindra tweeted, "This man's not only an auto driver...he's a Professor of Management." "If MBA students spent a day with him it would be a compressed course in Customer Experience Management," he added. Durai, a seven-time TEDx speaker, has facilities like books, mini-fridge, WiFi, TV and iPad in his auto-rickshaw.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: India's economy has some bright spots & a number of very dark stains: Rajan
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan on Sunday said the Indian economy has "some bright spots and a number of very dark stains". While the "bright spots" are the health of large firms and the business done by IT and IT-enabled sectors, the "dark stains" are the extent of unemployment and low buying power, especially amongst the lower middle-class, Rajan added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Taco Bell to start business school to train employees for franchise ownership
text: Taco Bell is opening first of its kind business school to help its employees learn the skills required to become future franchise owners. The program, which is being organised in partnership with the US’ University of Louisville, will teach employees lessons on financing, marketing, and human resource protocols among others. The first class will begin in February 2022.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Inflation only problem keeping me awake at night: Pak PM during live programme
text: Addressing a question on rising prices, Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday said that inflation was the "only problem keeping" him awake at night and added that the current inflation was a "global phenomenon". Khan said this during his live air programme 'Aap ka Wazir-e-Azam, Aap key Saath'. He also cited pandemic as a reason for current inflation in Pakistan.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Oil giant Shell drops 'Royal Dutch' from its name after 115 years
text: Oil giant Shell has officially dropped 'Royal Dutch' from its name, a phrase that was part of its identity for 115 years. The move follows its plans to scrap its dual share structure and relocate its headquarters from the Netherlands to London. Shell has been in a tussle with Dutch authorities over 15% dividend withholding tax on some shares.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia's crypto ban would drive out IT professionals: Telegram CEO
text: Messaging app Telegram's Russia-born CEO Pavel Durov said Russia's proposed ban on cryptocurrencies could lead to an outflow of IT professionals from the country and destroy several technology industries. Likening the proposal to ban cryptocurrencies to "throwing the baby out with the bath water", Durov wrote on his Telegram channel, "None of the developed nations is banning cryptocurrencies."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CAIT appeals to CCI to close probe against Amazon, Flipkart soon
text: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) sought a meeting with Competition Commission of India's (CCI) Chairman Ashok Kumar Gupta seeking probe against Amazon and Flipkart to be completed soon. CAIT alleged the firms to have indulged in predatory pricing and capital dumping through preferred sellers. It added that the investigating officer's transfer mid-way has irked the business community.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Morgan Stanley sells a portion of its stake in Paytm: Report
text: Morgan Stanley Asia (Singapore) has sold a substantial portion of its stake in Paytm parent One97 Communications, Moneycontrol reported. While Morgan Stanley held 1.21% stake in Paytm in September quarter, its name is missing from key shareholders' list in latest data. Notably, in December, Morgan Stanley's research arm gave an overweight rating on Paytm stock with price target of ₹1,875.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reached this stage after hard work, IPO should be bumper: MobiKwik COO
text: MobiKwik Co-founder and COO Upasana Taku told PTI the company will list on the stock exchanges once the market conditions become stable. "It's common sense that if markets are acting erratically...why do you want to risk the outcome of something for which you worked so hard?...We've reached this stage after hard work so IPO should be a bumper," she added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tax benefits to increase disposable income likely in Budget: Report
text: Brokerage firm KR Choksey has reported that the government may consider tax benefits in the upcoming Budget to increase the net disposable income of the citizens. The government will also put more focus on tax compliance. There might be some changes in InvIT and REIT tax structures to bring long-term capital gains treatment at par with other asset classes.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Consumer electronics industry seeks customs duty hike in Budget 2022
text: Consumer Electronics and Appliances Manufacturers Association said the industry expects a hike in customs duty on finished goods to discourage imports and facilitate import substitution in Budget 2022. It also sought incentives for specific R&D and localisation projects under the Production Linked Incentive scheme. CEAMA also suggested a 5% differential duty between parts and finished goods.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Vikram Dev Dutt takes charge as Air India's Chairman and MD
text: Vikram Dev Dutt has assumed charge as Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of Air India. The airline said Dutt took over the charge from Civil Aviation Secretary Rajiv Bansal. Dutt is an IAS officer of 1993 batch of AGMUT (Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, Mizoram and Union Territory) cadre. He's been appointed Air India CMD in rank and pay of Additional Secretary.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India no longer signs FTAs just to be a part of a group: Goyal
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal at a recent event said India no longer signs free trade agreements (FTAs) just to join a group, but is looking at reciprocal access, good market conditions and fair play in trade in goods and services. "An FTA is a two-way traffic," he said, adding that industry should inculcate a greater appetite for risk taking.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Travel agents body seeks 'One India One Tourism' approach in Budget
text: The Travel Agents Association of India (TAAI) is seeking a 'One India One Tourism' approach, which is inclusive of 'One Tax Structure', in the upcoming Budget to revive domestic travel, tourism and hospitality industry. The travel agents body has proposed several steps including improving cash flows, reducing working capital burden on startups and reducing income tax rate and GST rate.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CII suggests additional 1% CSR levy for COVID-19 vaccine booster shots
text: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has suggested that the government include an additional 1% corporate social responsibility (CSR) levy, apart from the mandated 2%, for a 12-month period in the upcoming Budget to encourage corporates to spend on providing COVID-19 vaccine booster shots. The industry body said it expects the Budget to focus on measures for strengthening economic recovery.
author: Hiral Goyal
