The trade deficit marginally reduced to $21.68 billion when compared to November, Commerce Ministry data showed on Friday. Imports in December 2021 also increased 38.55% to $59.48 billion on account of an increase in petroleum and crude oil imports.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RIL, M&M submit bid for India's $2.4 billion battery scheme: Report
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL), Mahindra & Mahindra and Hyundai Global Motors are reportedly among companies that have submitted bids under India's $2.4 billion battery scheme. Ola Electric, Larsen & Toubro and Exide have also submitted bids, Reuters reported citing sources. Indian government launched this incentive program last year to boost local manufacturing of batteries.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: GE suspends COVID-19 vaccine or test requirement after US Court's ruling
text: General Electric (GE) suspended its COVID-19 vaccine or test requirement policy for employees on Friday after the US Supreme Court's ruling. The court called the Joe Biden administration’s requirements a ''blunt instrument'' that ''draws no distinctions based on industry or risk of exposure to COVID-19.'' GE is the first major company to halt its policy after the Supreme Court's ruling.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala raises stake in Titan to 4.02% in Dec quarter
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala bought more shares of Titan Company in the quarter ended December 2021, increasing his stake in the company to 4.02% from 3.8% in the previous quarter. Meanwhile, Jhunjhunwala's wife Rekha's shareholding in Titan remained unchanged at 1.07%. The value of Jhunjhunwalas' stake in the Tata Group company stood at ₹11,738.10 crore as of Friday's closing price.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 'Ratan Tata shares pic with Guns N' Roses star Slash, Ranveer comments 'Too cool'
text: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata shared an old picture with Guns N' Roses star Slash. "The day I visited...Galpin Jaguar on...one of my retail outlet visits, I was excited to meet this gentleman...who was taking delivery of his new Jaguar XKR. A very polite rockstar, Slash," he wrote. "Wow!! This is too cool!" Ranveer Singh commented on the post.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Pakistan planning a complete ban on cryptocurrencies: Reports
text: The Pakistan government and the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP), Pakistan's central bank, are planning a complete ban on the use of all cryptocurrencies, according to reports. An SBP panel recommended that cryptocurrencies should be declared illegal and urged the Sindh High Court to impose penalties on crypto exchanges. This comes after Pakistan detected an alleged $100-million crypto scam.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Dogecoin jumps 20% as Elon Musk says Tesla merch now buyable with the crypto
text: Dogecoin jumped around 20% after Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday tweeted, "Tesla merch buyable with Dogecoin." The electric carmaker has started displaying some of its products' prices in the meme-based cryptocurrency on its website, including 'Cyberquad' for kids and Cybertruck-inspired 'Cyberwhistle'. This comes a month after Musk, who is the world's richest person, had revealed plans to do so.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt says Tesla trying to pressurise India after Musk tweets on launch hurdles: Report
text: After Elon Musk said he's working through "a lot of challenges" for Tesla's India launch, a government official reportedly said, "Tesla's trying to put pressure...by using social media." Tesla can bring cars in "knocked down form with zero duty", the official told ET. The firm wants a reduction in import duties "without commitment to producing in India", the official added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm stock slips below ₹1,000 for 1st time since listing, then rebounds
text: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications slipped below ₹1,000 apiece in the opening trade on Friday for the first time since its listing in November. The stock hit an all-time low of ₹995 apiece before recovering some of its losses. It has eroded over half of the value from its IPO price of ₹2,150 apiece in less than two months.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 118-year-old Ford's market cap tops $100 billion for the 1st time ever
text: Ford Motor's market capitalisation soared to $100 billion for the first time ever on Thursday as its stock hit a 20-year high after it announced plans to increase EV production. This made the 118-year-old automaker more valuable than General Motors ($90 billion) and Rivian Automotive ($72 billion). However, it still lags behind Tesla's $1 trillion market capitalisation.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm CEO says global market conditions affected company's IPO
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said that the negative macro conditions affected Paytm's IPO. "Globally, we probably went in at a time (for IPO) when QE, free money and many other parameters brought in a little spookiness to the market," said Sharma. "South American companies are over 70% down...Well, that's not the reason completely. That's a macro reason," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Union Budget 2022-23 to be presented on February 1
text: The government will present the Union Budget for 2022-23 on February 1. The first part of the Parliament's budget session will begin on January 31 and conclude on February 11. The first day of the session will see the government presenting the Economic Survey. The second part of the session will begin from March 14 and conclude on April 8.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 10-year-old girl, who's made millions from her 2 companies, could retire at 15
text: A 10-year-old Australian girl had set up a toy company called Pixie's Fidgets last year that has been making huge profits. Pixie Curtis also has a hair accessories business, Pixie's Bows, that her mother started when she was a baby, and she is making millions from both. "She can retire at 15 if she wants to," her mother said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Google to buy Central Saint Giles offices in London for $1 billion
text: Google is purchasing Central Saint Giles development, a central London building where it is currently a tenant, for $1 billion. Google said it will refurbish the offices to create a future flexible workplace. Notably, Google's new London headquarters is currently under construction. The 11-storey building will include a swimming pool, an indoor basketball court, massage rooms and a roof garden.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Flipkart acquires refurbished electronics seller Yaantra
text: Flipkart on Thursday announced that it has acquired electronics recommerce company Yaantra to enhance its after sale offerings for its consumers in the smartphone segment. However, Flipkart did not disclose the acquisition amount. Yaantra, which repairs and sells refurbished consumer tech products such as smartphones, was incorporated in 2013 by Jayant Jha, Ankit Saraf and Anmol Gupta.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Volkswagen China shuts 2 Tianjin plants due to COVID-19 outbreaks
text: Volkswagen's China unit has shut a plant it jointly runs with FAW Group in Tianjin, as well as a component factory, due to recent COVID-19 outbreaks there. "Both plants have conducted COVID-19 testing twice for all employees this week," the automaker said. The city of Tianjin on Wednesday started the second round of COVID-19 testing of its 14 million residents.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Delhivery gets SEBI's approval for ₹7,460-crore IPO: Report
text: Gurugram-based logistics startup Delhivery has received markets regulator SEBI's approval for its ₹7,460-crore IPO, reported ET Now. According to its DRHP, Delhivery's IPO will comprise a fresh issue of shares worth ₹5,000 crore and an offer-for-sale of shares worth ₹2,460 crore. Delhivery investors, including Carlyle, SoftBank, Times Internet, are planning to sell part of their stakes in the IPO.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's wholesale inflation eases to 13.56% in December
text: India's Wholesale Price Index-based (WPI) inflation eased to 13.56% in December 2021, driven by a fall in prices of fuel items, data released by the Commerce Ministry showed. The food articles segment witnessed a 9.56 per cent surge. In November, the WPI rose to a 12-year high of 14.23%, while October's WPI data was revised to 13.83% from 12.54%.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Aditya Birla Fashion to acquire 51% stake in House of Masaba for ₹90 crore
text: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail has said that it will acquire 51% stake in Masaba Gupta's fashion label House of Masaba Lifestyle for ₹90 crore. The tie-up will mark ABFRL's entry into the beauty and personal care market in India. The two companies also target to build a business worth ₹500 crore in the next five years.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Banks credit growth rises by ₹3.5 lakh crore in Q3: SBI report
text: Demand for credit increased across sectors in the December quarter, according to a research report by State Bank of India (SBI). Incremental deposits in the banking system have declined by ₹2.2 lakh crore over this period, whereas credit growth has picked up by ₹3.5 lakh crore, the report stated. The report also suggested that demand from non-PSU credit will increase.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Goyal meets UK's Int'l Trade Secretary over free trade agreement
text: India's Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal today met with United Kingdom's Secretary of State for International Trade Anne-Marie Trevelyan for the formal launch of negotiations for a free trade agreement. Goyal said in a tweet that during the negotiation, "deliberations will be held over an array of trade opportunities of mutual interest benefitting both sides".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CBDT issues refunds of over ₹1.5 lakh cr from Apr 1, 2020 to Jan 10, 2021
text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) issued refunds of over ₹1,54,302 crore to more than 1.59 crore taxpayers between April 1, 2020, and January 10, 2021, the Income Tax Department said on Thursday. "This includes 1.20 crore refunds of AY 2021-22 amounting to ₹23,406.28 crore," it said. Of the total refunds, 1.46 crore cases are of income tax returns.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Go Airlines' ₹3,600-cr IPO plan put on hold amid Omicron surge: Report
text: Wadia Group has reportedly deferred the ₹3,600-crore initial public offering plan of its company Go Airlines due to the rapid surge in Omicron COVID-19 variant cases and its adverse impact on the travel business. Wadia Group is likely to pump in the additional fund in Go Airlines as it requires capital for operational expenses, ET reported citing sources.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Blackstone asks US staff to get COVID-19 booster shots to work in office
text: Blackstone has asked its US staff to get COVID-19 booster shots "as soon as practically possible" to work in the office. Employees will need to be tested on-site three times a week, the company's spokesperson said on Wednesday. Blackstone recently pushed back the date to begin work from office from January 18 to January 28 amid Omicron scare.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Amazon aggregator Thrasio to invest $500 mn for India e-commerce expansion
text: Thrasio, an aggregator of private brands on Amazon, is planning to invest over $500 million for e-commerce expansion in India. Thrasio said it acquired consumer goods company Lifelong Online to commence the push. ''We plan to participate in the 'Make in India' movement by transitioning the manufacturing for some of our products to the country,'' Thrasio CEO Carlos Cashman said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India, UK to work on improving trade relation, address market barriers
text: A joint statement issued by Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and UK's State Secretary for International Trade Anne-Marie Trevelyan said that the two countries will work on improving trade relations. The statement added that India and UK will consider the option of an Interim Agreement that generates early benefits for both countries. The two countries will also address market access barriers.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: China's trade surplus hits a record high at $676 billion in 2021
text: China's trade surplus rose to $94.5 billion in December, taking the total trade surplus for 2021 to an all-time high of $676 billion. Its exports in December stood at $340.5 billion, taking the full-year total to $3.36 trillion, as per customs data. The country's total imports for 2021 were at $2.69 trillion, including $246 billion in December.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Mindtree stock falls 4% after company posts rise in net profit
text: Shares of IT firm Mindtree ended 4.19% lower on Friday after the company posted a 34% jump in consolidated net profit at ₹437.5 crore for the December quarter. The Bengaluru-based company's revenue came in at ₹2,750 crore in the third quarter, registering a growth of 36% from the year-ago period. Mindtree's stock has fallen after three days of consecutive gain.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RBI's sub-committee reviews global, domestic economic scenario
text: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Financial Stability and Development Council (FSDC) met today under the chairmanship of RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das to review major global and domestic economic developments. "[FSDC] discussed the assessments of members about the scenario emerging from third wave of COVID-19 pandemic," RBI said in a statement. It also discussed use of Aadhaar based e-KYC.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani Wilmar cuts IPO size from ₹4,500 crore to ₹3,600 crore: Report
text: Adani Wilmar, a joint venture between Adani Group and Singapore's Wilmar group, has cut the size of its initial public offering (IPO) to ₹3,600 crore, PTI reported. The company had earlier planned to raise ₹4,500 crore through a fresh issue of equity shares, as per its draft red herring prospectus. Adani Wilmar sells edible oils under the Fortune brand.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RIL commits ₹5.95 lakh cr investment to make Gujarat carbon-free
text: Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) said that it has committed to invest ₹5.95 lakh crore in various green projects in Gujarat. RIL proposes to invest ₹5 lakh crore over the next 10-15 years to set up 100 GW of renewable energy projects. It also committed investment of ₹60,000 crore in setting up a new integrated manufacturing unit for new, renewable energy.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Navi Health Insurance promises to provide complete Covid-19 protection
text: With the rise in Omicron and Covid cases in the country, Navi believes people need health plans that provide complete Covid coverage. That's why Navi Health Insurance is offering health plans that aim to cover all Covid-related hospitalization costs. With a waiting period of 30 days, Navi Health Insurance also offers monthly premiums starting at ₹241.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Infosys to hire 10,000 additional freshers for 2021-22
text: Infosys on Wednesday announced that it has expanded its college graduate hiring program by 10,000 to over 55,000 for 2021-22 to support its "growth ambitions". This comes after Infosys' attrition rate for the quarter zoomed to 25.5% compared to 20.1% in the second quarter. Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy said they have a three-pronged strategy to stop people from leaving.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: TCS, Wipro, Infosys added record 1.7 lakh employees in 2021
text: IT companies TCS, Infosys and Wipro added a record 1.7 lakh employees in 2021, as compared to the 31,000 they had hired in 2020. For the first three quarters of FY22, the three companies hired 1.34 lakh employees. While TCS recorded a net addition of 87,725 employees in 2021, Wipro and Infosys added 41,363 and 42,755 employees, respectively.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bezos' girlfriend shares montage of his childhood pics & early days at Amazon on b'day
text: World's second richest person Jeff Bezos' girlfriend Lauren Sanchez shared a montage, which included pictures from his childhood and early days at Amazon, on his 58th birthday. "If I had one wish for you...it would be that the world will see you through my eyes," she wrote. Bezos was born on January 12, 1964 and founded Amazon in 1994.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: What's the rate at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
text: India's top IT company TCS' attrition rate rose to 15.3% in the October-December period from 11.9% in the previous quarter, however, it claimed it's the "lowest in the industry". Second-largest IT firm Infosys' attrition rate rose to 25.5%, while Wipro's attrition rate rose to 22.7%. Attrition rate is used to describe the rate at which employees are leaving the company.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Wipro to close offices globally for the next 4 weeks due to COVID-19 surge
text: Wipro on Wednesday said it will shut down all its offices globally for the next four weeks following a surge in the COVID-19 cases. The company's CEO Thierry Delaporte said the company would re-calibrate return to office initiatives in light of the evolving situation. Wipro's senior executives have been coming to the office twice a week since September.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I would rather not be: Paytm CEO on becoming a shark on Shark Tank
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma said that he won't be a shark on the startup reality show Shark Tank. "Do you see Michael Moritz (Sequoia) and Marc Andreessen (a16z) on Shark Tank? No! It's meant for a particular type of thing," said Sharma. He said this in a fireside chat with Sequoia India MD Rajan Anandan during India Digital Summit.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm shares erode over half of IPO investors' wealth in 2 months
text: Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares hit an all-time low below ₹1,030 apiece during intraday trade on Thursday, eroding over half of the value from its IPO price of ₹2,150 apiece. At the IPO price, the firm was worth around ₹1.39 lakh crore, but its market value now stands below ₹70,000 crore. Earlier, Macquarie Research retained 'underperform' rating on the stock.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Working through lot of challenges with Indian govt: Elon Musk on Tesla launch
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has said that he's "still working through a lot of challenges" with the government for Tesla's launch in India. The Tesla CEO was responding to an Indian engineer's tweet which sought an update on the launch. Last year, Tesla urged India to slash import taxes on electric vehicles before it enters the market.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Youth disillusionment among top 5 risks for India: World Economic Forum
text: The World Economic Forum's (WEF) latest report listed "widespread youth disillusionment" among the top five risks for India. "Youth disillusionment" is negatively impacting social stability, individual well-being and economic productivity, the WEF said. The other risks are fracture of interstate relations, debt crises in large economies, failure of technology governance and digital inequality.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US inflation jumps 7% in biggest annual increase in 39 years
text: The consumer price inflation in the US jumped in December 2021 at its fastest year-over-year pace since June 1982, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported. Inflation rose 7% in December 2021 from the same month a year ago, up from 6.8% in November. The largest contributors to the inflation were price increases in housing and used vehicles.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Adani signs $5 bn pact with S Korea's largest steelmaker, plans steel mill in Gujarat
text: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group and South Korea's largest steelmaker POSCO have signed a non-binding pact to explore business opportunities in India, including setting up of a green steel mill in Gujarat. The companies said the investment is estimated to be up to $5 billion. They intend to collaborate in various industries such as renewable energy, hydrogen and logistics.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Retail inflation rises to 5.59% in Dec compared to 4.91% in Nov
text: India's retail inflation rose to 5.59% in the month of December from 4.91% in November, government data revealed. This is the sixth consecutive month that CPI data has come below the Reserve Bank of India's upper margin of 6%. India's factory output, measured in terms of Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a year-on-year growth of 1.4% in November.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Infosys Q3 profit rises 12% y-o-y to ₹5,809 crore
text: Indian IT giant Infosys reported a consolidated net profit of ₹5,809 crore for the three months ending December 31, 2021, recording a nearly 12% rise year-on-year. Its revenue from operations rose 23% at ₹31,867 crore as against ₹25,927 crore in the same period in 2020. Infosys scrip rose 1.09% on Wednesday to close at ₹1,875 apiece on NSE.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: BMW brand delivers record 2.21 million vehicles in 2021
text: The BMW brand delivered an all-time high of 2.21 million vehicles in 2021, up 9.1% from 2020, the company revealed. It also more than doubled its sales of fully-electric vehicles globally. The BMW Group delivered 2.52 million vehicles, an 8.4% increase from 2020. Earlier, Rolls-Royce announced that it created history last year selling the most cars it has ever sold.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: NCLAT to hear plea against suspension of CCI's Amazon-Future deal approval
text: National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) agreed to hear Amazon's plea against Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order suspending its approval of the Amazon-Future Group deal. In 2019, Amazon had invested in Future Group by acquiring a 49% stake in Future Coupons. CCI suspended the deal's approval last month saying Amazon failed to notify its strategic interest in Future Group.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 20 lakh tonnes of food grains distributed under PMGKAY since Dec
text: The government said it has distributed nearly 20 lakh tonnes of free food grains so far to eligible beneficiaries under the fifth phase of Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (PMGKAY). The Centre had allocated a total of 163 lakh tonnes of rice and wheat to all states and UTs for distribution from December 2021 to March 2022.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Wipro shares tumble over 6% after company releases Q3 earnings
text: Shares of Wipro declined by over 6% during intraday trade on Thursday, a day after the IT services provider declared its December quarter results. Wipro posted 29.6% rise in company's revenue to ₹20,313 crore but flat net profit growth at ₹2,970 crore in the third quarter. Wipro shares have declined 9.2% so far this year, as per Reuters.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: SC criticises Supertech over non-payment to home buyers in Noida
text: The Supreme Court criticised real-estate developer Supertech over non-payment to home buyers of Noida's Emerald Court which was ordered to be demolished in August 2021. The bench headed by Justice DY Chandrachud told Supertech to ensure payment to home buyers by January 17. The bench also directed Supertech to not deduct any amount while returning the money to home buyers.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: TCS Q3 profits rise 12% YoY in FY22 to ₹9,769 crore
text: Tata Consultancy Services' revenues rose 12% YoY in Q3 of FY22 to ₹9,769 crore according to the company's exchange filing. TCS also won new deals worth over ₹56,126 crore. Its revenue from operations rose 16% to ₹48,885 crore as compared to ₹42,015 crore in Q3 of FY21. The company has also approved buyback of shares worth up to ₹18,000 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: PM Modi's PLI scheme to help Indian economy beat China in FY23: World Bank
text: PM Narendra Modi's Production-Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme will likely help India grow faster than emerging market peers including China, the World Bank said. It revised India's estimated GDP growth rate for FY23 to 8.7% and for FY24 to 6.8% "to reflect an improving investment outlook...and increases in infrastructure investment". The Centre launched the five-year PLI scheme for 13 key sectors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Most complaints filed by foreign, private bank customers: RBI Report
text: RBI's annual report on various ombudsman schemes stated that customers of foreign and private banks filed the most complaints between July 2020 and March 2021. Foreign and private banks witnessed 0.14 and 0.127 non-digital complaints against them per 1,000 accounts respectively. Public sector and small finance banks witnessed only 0.05 and 0.025 complaints against them per 1,000 accounts.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FICCI suggests support measures for housing sector in upcoming Budget
text: FICCI suggested the government to provide an interest subsidy of 3-4% on housing loans as one of the support measures for the housing sector in the upcoming Budget. It added that concessional tax rate of 15% must be extended to companies that invest in green technologies. It also suggested subsidy on usage of 6-7 cylinders per year for poor households.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Vodafone Idea to issue 35.8% shares to govt in a month's time: CEO
text: Vodafone Idea (Vi) expects to issue shares to the government in the coming month, CEO Ravinder Takkar has said. On Tuesday, Vi opted to convert the interest on its government dues into equity. Vi has estimated the net present value of the interest at ₹16,000 crore and that would result in issuance of 35.8% shares to the government.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rupee won't have choice but to depreciate in long term: ICICI Bank
text: The Indian rupee is likely to weaken after foreign inflows that have helped it appreciate at the start of the year begin to ebb in coming months, a senior ICICI Bank official said. "INR will appreciate short term but have no choice but to depreciate long term," Prasanna Balachander, ICICI Bank's group head for global markets sales, added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Wipro posts ₹2,970 crore net profit in Q3, revenue jumps 30%
text: Wipro on Wednesday reported nearly flat consolidated net profit at ₹2,970 crore in the October-December quarter, as against ₹2,968 crore profit reported in the year-ago period. The company's revenue from operations grew 29.6% to ₹20,313 crore from ₹15,670 crore in the quarter ended December 2020. Wipro also declared an interim dividend of Re 1 per equity share.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Indian pharma industry's growth slows to 5.3% in December
text: The growth in Indian pharma industry slowed to 5.3% year-on-year in December 2021, as compared to 8.5% growth in December 2020, as per a report by Motilal Oswal. According to India Ratings and Research, volumes declined 1.5% year-on-year, while price growth was at 5.4%. New product launches surged 1.4% over the preceding year, it said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Navi Mutual Fund launches Nifty Next 50 Index Fund, NFO closes on Jan 14
text: Navi Nifty Next 50 Index Fund aims to replicate a portfolio comprising stocks of the Nifty Next 50 Index. It proposes to charge a TER of 0.12% p.a. for direct plans, the lowest in this category*. The fund is currently available to invest on platforms including Paytm Money, Kuvera, Coin, Groww and INDmoney. The NFO closes on Friday, January 14.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Work from anywhere, commute by plane when needed: Yahoo to 8,000 Japan employees
text: Yahoo Japan has told its 8,000 employees that they can work from anywhere and can even be flown into work when needed. The program will take effect on April 1 and Yahoo has set a commuting budget of 150,000 yen ($1,300) per month per worker. Before COVID-19, Yahoo had capped the number of work-from-home days to five days a month.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Japanese toaster company Balmuda's stock crashes after launching smartphone
text: Japan's high-end toaster company Balmuda's stock has crashed after it entered the smartphone market with its 'Balmuda Phone', which received a poor response. Balmuda's shares fell as much as 10% in Tuesday trading, a day after Balmuda said it paused smartphone sales due to an unidentified issue regarding compliance. The 'Balmuda Phone' is more expensive than the iPhone 13 mini.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: COVID-19 deaths made people think life can be short: Rolls-Royce CEO on record sales
text: After British luxury carmaker Rolls-Royce recorded the best annual sales in its 117-year history, CEO Torsten Müller-Otvös said COVID-19 deaths helped spur sales. "Lot of people witnessed people in their community dying from COVID-19, that makes them think life can be short, and you'd better live now than postpone it to a later date," he told The FT.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: What are the 10 most severe threats the world is facing according to WEF?
text: The World Economic Forum (WEF) listed the top 10 global risks on the basis of their severity over the next 10 years. Climate action failure is the most severe risk, followed by extreme weather, biodiversity loss, erosion of social cohesion, livelihood crises, infectious diseases, human environmental damage and others. Societal risks make up a third of the top 10 risks.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt may seek ₹15 lakh crore valuation for LIC in India's biggest-ever IPO: Report
text: The government may seek a valuation of about ₹15 lakh crore for LIC through its IPO, which will be India's biggest-ever, Bloomberg reported citing sources. LIC's embedded value, which combines current value of future profits with net value of assets, may reportedly be over ₹4 lakh crore. Earlier, reports said LIC may file IPO papers in last week of January.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Vodafone Idea shares jump 11% as CEO rules out takeover by government
text: Shares of Vodafone Idea jumped over 11% on Wednesday after CEO Ravinder Takkar clarified that the government won't take over the company. He said the government wants promoters to run the company. Vi's stock tanked 21% on Tuesday after it announced that the government will own 35.8% stake following conversion of its dues into equity, making it the largest shareholder.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt doesn't want to run Vodafone Idea, it wants 3 private telecom players: CEO
text: Vodafone Idea CEO Ravinder Takkar has said the government stated in all its interactions that it doesn't want to run the company. The government wants "promoters to run the company" and wants three private telecom players, he added. This comes after Vi said the government will own 35.8% stake after converting its dues to equity, making it Vi's largest shareholder.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex reclaims 61,000 for the 1st time after two months
text: Indian benchmark index Sensex jumped more than 500 points on Wednesday during intraday trade to reclaim the 61,000-mark for the first time after nearly two months. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped around 150 points to trade at 18,200 levels. The market rally came ahead of Q3 earnings report of three of India's top IT companies - TCS, Wipro, Infosys.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: World's worst-performing bank lent billions to China's crisis-hit Evergrande Group
text: China Minsheng Banking Corp, which lent billions to property developers including crisis-hit Evergrande Group, has become the world's worst-performing banking stock on the 155-member Bloomberg World Banks Index. Minsheng's stock tumbled 31% in the 12 months through last week. Earlier, a report by Citigroup said Minsheng had about 130 billion yuan ($20 billion) of exposure to high-risk developers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: FICCI makes recommendations to Health Minister to tackle virus surge
text: Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI) made recommendations for tackling rising COVID-19 cases in a letter to Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya. FICCI made six suggestions including reduction in quarantine period to five days, especially for healthcare workers. "Mobility restrictions must be based on [a region's] hospital bed occupancy, oxygen consumption," it suggested.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Need for global framework to guide national crypto regulation: IMF staff
text: The increasing rate of adoption of crypto assets by governments warrants a global framework to guide their regulation and supervision, according to staff of the International Monetary Fund (IMF). Tobias Adrian, Tara Iyer and Mahvash Qureshi of the IMF wrote in an article that a framework is needed to "mitigate the financial stability risks stemming from the crypto ecosystem".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ex-Finance Secretary suggests 3 laws to regulate India's crypto market
text: Former Finance Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg on Tuesday suggested three laws around three use cases of crypto tech - digital currencies, crypto businesses and crypto assets. He suggested a ban on private cryptos except for limited use like stable coins. He then suggested a law to regulate crypto businesses like crypto exchanges and a different law to regulate crypto assets.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Mercedes to become 1st global luxury carmaker to make EVs in India
text: Luxury carmaker Mercedes-Benz plans to start local assembly of its EQS electric sedan in India this year, becoming the first global luxury carmaker to assemble electric vehicles (EVs) in India. Mercedes expects to start selling the locally-assembled EQS in India in the fourth quarter of 2022. It started selling imported models of its EQC electric SUV in India in 2020.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Paytm shares fall to record low, down 47% from issue price
text: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications fell to a record low on Tuesday despite the company reporting a jump in loan disbursals in the December 2021 quarter. The company's shares hit a record low of ₹1,113.65 on the NSE, down 47% from its issue price. Earlier on Monday, financial services provider Macquarie had retained its 'underperform' rating on Paytm's stock.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla's top-ranking Black executive and VP of People steps down
text: Tesla's VP of People and one of the company's highest-ranking Black executives, Valerie Capers Workman, is stepping down from her position, Bloomberg confirmed. Workman is joining US-based career-network company Handshake next week as Chief Legal Officer. She joined Tesla's legal department in 2018 and was elevated to her current position in 2020, where she reported directly to CEO Elon Musk.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Louis Simpson, who helped Warren Buffett pick stocks, dies at 85
text: Louis Simpson, who helped pick stocks for Berkshire Hathaway's billionaire Chairman Warren Buffett, has died at the age of 85. Simpson died in Chicago on January 8 following a prolonged illness, according to the Northwestern University in Illinois. He managed the investment portfolio of insurance giant GEICO, which was fully acquired by Berkshire Hathaway in 1996, between 1979 and 2010.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Teleservices opts for equity conversion, govt to own 9.5% stake
text: Tata Teleservices said on Tuesday it will opt for the conversion of interest related to adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues into equity. "Following conversion, it is expected that the government will hold approximately 9.5% of the total outstanding shares of the company," Tata Teleservices said. The company estimates the net present value of the interest to be nearly ₹850 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India to see 9.5% economic growth in FY22: Ex-Chief Economic Adviser
text: Former Chief Economic Adviser Arvind Virmani said on Tuesday that the Indian economy is likely to register a growth of 9.5% in FY22. He said that government expenditure and exports have peaked but private consumption is yet to recover from effects of the COVID-19 pandemic. "This decade’s (FY21-FY30) average growth will be 7.5% plus minus 0.5%," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's economy expected to grow at 8.3% in FY22: World Bank
text: The World Bank on Tuesday retained its forecast for India's GDP growth in the fiscal year ending March 2022. According to its Global Economic Prospects report, India's economy is expected to grow at 8.3% in FY22. The World Bank further upgraded its forecast for India's GDP growth in FY23 and FY24 to 8.7% and 6.8%, respectively.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Airbus retains world's largest planemaker spot for 3rd straight year
text: Airbus retained its world's largest planemaker title for the third consecutive year after the company delivered 611 jets in 2021, taking the sales up by 8% compared to the previous year. Airbus outstripped Boeing, which sold 340 jets in 2021. Airbus Chief Executive Guillaume Faury called this the ''first fruits of a recovery'' and said ''demand is real''.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India, Republic of Korea aim to achieve $50 bn trade target before 2030
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal today met with Republic of Korea's Trade Minister Yeo Han-Koo and decided to actively pursue their aim of achieving bilateral trade worth $50 billion by 2030. The two ministers held wide ranging discussions on bilateral trade and investment related aspects. They also agreed to step up negotiations on Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA).
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Citi to exit consumer biz in Mexico, where it has operated for 100 yrs
text: Citigroup will exit the consumer, small business and middle-market banking operations in Mexico, where it has operated for over 100 years, the bank announced. However, it'll continue to operate a locally-licensed banking business in Mexico through its global Institutional Clients Group. The bank's acquisition of Banamex for $12.5 billion in 2001 was the largest ever in Mexico at that time.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: I-T return filing deadline for AY 2021-22 in specific cases extended to March 15
text: Due dates for filing specific income tax returns and audit reports for AY 2021-22 were extended on Tuesday. The due date for furnishing certain audit reports is extended to February 15 and the deadline for furnishing tax returns that require auditing is extended to March 15, 2022. The deadline for individual taxpayers was December 31, 2021.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India to add 16 GW of renewable energy capacity in 2022-23: ICRA
text: India's renewable energy generation capacity addition in 2022-23 is estimated at 16 gigawatt (GW), rating agency ICRA said. The outlook for capacity addition remains strong due to a large project pipeline and highly competitive tariffs offered by these projects, ICRA added in its statement. India's renewable energy capacity addition during April-November 2021 stood at 8.2 GW.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Companies that win the talent war will be winners: Rishad Premji
text: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji at Microsoft's Future Ready event said the number one challenge companies face right now is talent and any company that can win talent war will be the winner. "I'm a big believer of retaining employees. People don't only leave for compensation, they leave when they don't feel a sense of connectedness with the organisation," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Group replaces Chinese mobile manufacturer VIVO as IPL title sponsor
text: Tata Group will replace Chinese mobile manufacturer VIVO as IPL title sponsor from the upcoming season, IPL Chairman Brijesh Patel said. VIVO had originally signed a ₹2,200-crore deal for IPL title sponsorship rights from 2018 to 2022, however, it backed out as title sponsor for IPL 2020 before returning in 2021. VIVO's contract was then extended till 2023.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Binance CEO richer than Mukesh Ambani with $96 billion wealth: Bloomberg
text: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao is the world's richest cryptocurrency entrepreneur with $96 billion wealth, Bloomberg said after estimating his net worth for the first time. It added that the 44-year-old is richer than Asia's richest person Mukesh Ambani, whose current net worth is $92.9 billion. Zhao is a former McDonald's employee and software developer.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: GTA maker Take-Two to buy FarmVille creator Zynga in a $12.7 billion deal
text: Take-Two Interactive, the video game maker behind Grand Theft Auto, will acquire mobile gaming company Zynga in a cash-and-stock deal worth nearly $12.7 billion. Take-Two will acquire all outstanding shares of Zynga at a 64% premium to the company's closing price on Friday. Shares of FarmVille maker Zynga rose about 50% in US pre-market trading after the announcement.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Lenskart Co-founder apologises for 'stay away from CAs' remark, says dad, sister are CAs
text: Lenskart Co-founder Peyush Bansal has apologised after he was criticised for asking PNT Robotics' founders to "stay away from CAs" during a reality TV show. Bansal tweeted that it was a "light-hearted comment made in jest", aimed at promoting entrepreneurship. He added that his father, sister and Lenskart's CFO are all CAs and he depends on them "to run Lenskart".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ant Group's stake in Paytm loses ₹16,000 crore in value in 2 months of listing: Report
text: Paytm shares owned by China's Ant Group lost around ₹16,012 crore in value in first two months of its listing, Business Insider reported. Ant Group had sold 3% stake at IPO price of ₹2,150 apiece, but still owns around 24% stake. Value of its residual stake in Paytm could've been worth ₹34,669 crore if the stock maintained its IPO price.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 60,000 employees fired by Chinese edtech firm after crackdown on tutoring firms
text: China's edtech major New Oriental Education & Technology Group's Founder Yu Minhong revealed that the company fired 60,000 employees and saw its revenue fall 80% in 2021. He cited factors like China's crackdown on the after-school education sector, the COVID-19 pandemic and China's international relations for the move. "Much of our business remains in a state of uncertainty," he said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: What is the legal battle between BharatPe's MD & Kotak Mahindra Bank?
text: BharatPe MD Ashneer Grover and his wife sent a legal notice to Kotak Mahindra Bank on October 30, accusing the bank of failing to provide financing in Nykaa's IPO. An alleged audio clip of Grover threatening and abusing a Kotak employee went viral, which Grover called "fake". Kotak Group on Sunday said it raised "objections to inappropriate language" by Grover.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Standard income tax deduction could rise by 30-35% in Budget: Report
text: The government is looking into a proposal to increase the standard deduction limit available to salaried taxpayers and pensioners by 30-35% in Budget 2022-23, an official from the Finance Ministry told ET. However, the income tax slabs are reportedly likely to remain unchanged. The standard deduction was enhanced to ₹50,000 by the government in the interim Budget in 2019.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: UC Berkeley professor Pierre-Olivier succeeds Gita Gopinath as IMF Chief Economist
text: The IMF has appointed Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas as its next Chief Economist, succeeding India-born Gita Gopinath. Gourinchas is the University of California at Berkeley's Faculty Director of the Clausen Center for International Business and Policy. He will start his new position on January 24 part-time and transition to full-time on April 1. Gopinath will become IMF's First Deputy MD.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Robert Durst, US multi-millionaire real estate heir convicted of murder, dies at 78
text: Multi-millionaire real estate heir Robert Durst, who was sentenced to life in prison in October for murdering his best friend, has died at 78 in a California prison hospital, according to his attorney. He was also charged with murder of his first wife Kathleen Durst, who disappeared in 1982. Robert Durst was the subject of a 2015 HBO documentary series.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt to change FDI rules for LIC's IPO, India's biggest-ever: Report
text: Government authorities will amend rules on FDI for the success of LIC's IPO, set to be India's biggest-ever, Bloomberg reported. While equity stakes among foreigners are allowed for most Indian insurers, it's not allowed in LIC as it's a special entity created by an act of Parliament. LIC's IPO is expected to raise between ₹40,000 crore and ₹1 lakh crore.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Vodafone Idea says govt to own 36% stake in firm after converting dues, shares crash
text: Vodafone Idea's board has approved the conversion of interest on spectrum auction instalments and adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues into equity. With this, the government will own about 35.8% stake in Vi, making it the largest shareholder. The promoter shareholders Vodafone Group would hold 28.5% and Aditya Birla Group 17.8%, Vi said. The stock fell around 17% following the news.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Dubai-based BR Shetty, who's stranded in India, ordered to pay $131 mn to Barclays
text: India-born businessman BR Shetty, the Founder of Dubai-based NMC Health, has been ordered to pay $131 million (₹968.5 crore) to Barclays by a London court. Shetty's forex business failed to meet a transaction agreement with the British bank in 2020. Shetty, who has lost most of his wealth, is stranded in India after being banned from returning to the UAE.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bitcoin falls below $40,000 for the first time in over five months
text: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin's price fell below $40,000 for the first time in over five months on Monday. Bitcoin fell more than 5% to as low as $39,558, marking the largest decline for the cryptocurrency for a start of the year since at least 2012. Ether, the second largest cryptocurrency, also fell as much as 7.2% to $2,926 on Monday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ED attaches assets worth ₹36 crore in 'Morris Coin' crypto case
text: The Enforcement Directorate has attached assets of a Kerala-based businessman and his associates worth ₹36.72 crore under PMLA, 2002, in a cheating case. The accused had allegedly cheated 900 investors of ₹1,200 crore under the guise of offering 'Morris coin' cryptocurrency. The attached assets include balances in multiple bank accounts, immovable property and INR equivalent of cryptocurrencies.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Workers to return to Foxconn's TN plant gradually, says Apple
text: Apple on Monday said that workers will return to work gradually at its Foxconn's plant at Sriperumbudur near Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Earlier, the state's CM MK Stalin had said that the Foxconn plant will resume operations on January 12, initially with 500 workers. The plant was shut last month after a food poisoning incident affected over 200 workers.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Panasonic offers 4-day work week option to staff, allows side jobs
text: Japanese multinational conglomerate Panasonic Corporation will offer employees an option to work four days a week, CEO Yuki Kusumi said in an investor briefing. Panasonic will also allow employees to take up side jobs or spend time volunteering on their extra days off. Further, employees will be able to work from home when their partners are transferred to other locations.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Volkswagen sells 70,600 ID EVs in China in 2021, misses target
text: German automaker Volkswagen sold 70,625 of its ID electric vehicles in China last year, missing its goal of selling 80,000 to 1,00,000 cars. The automaker said it would likely double sales of its ID battery electric vehicles in China this year. Volkswagen Group sold 3.3 million cars in China last year, a fall of 14% from 2020.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Rolls-Royce car sales soar to highest in its 117-year history
text: Rolls-Royce on Monday announced that it created history last year selling the most cars it has ever sold in its 117-year history. The luxury carmaker sold 5,586 cars globally last year, up 49% from its sales in the same period in 2020. Sales of the brand's vehicles hit all-time records in most regions, including China and the US.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: COVID didn't impact India's long-term growth trajectory: N Chandrasekaran
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran on Tuesday said that the COVID-19 pandemic has not impacted India's long-term growth trajectory although it has delayed it. In this decade, the country will lead the global growth rates, he added. ''I think the Indian situation is pretty unique and India's growth is going to be more fundamentally important going forward,'' Chandrasekaran further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: SC reserves order on allowing FRL to proceed with Reliance deal
text: Supreme Court has reserved order on pleas filed by Future Group companies seeking permission to proceed with procedural steps for its asset sale deal with Reliance. "If the final order is in Amazon's favour, the deal won't go through, but if we win, we'll have saved the time to then start the process," Future Retail's (FRL) counsel told the court.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt finalises medical insurance for retired staff of Air India: Reports
text: The government has finalised a solution to provide medical insurance to the 30,000 retired staff members of Air India who had opted for the post-retirement medical scheme, Economic Times reported. "Retired employees will get the Central Government Health Scheme facility for OPD requirement and National Health Insurance Scheme for their hospitalisation requirements," a top government official said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India eyes place in top 25 of Global Innovation Index: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Monday that the government is striving to take India to the top 25 in the Global Innovation Index. Addressing the Startup India Innovation Week, Goyal said that startups have played a significant role in India's rise from the 76th position in 2014 to the 46th position in the Index in 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India to allow imports of US pork for 1st time: US Agriculture Secy
text: India has agreed to allow imports of US pork and pork products for the first time, US Trade Representative Katherine Tai and Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack said. ''The deal marked the culmination of two decades of seeking market access for US pork to India,'' Vilsack added. In 2021, US exported more than $1.6 billion of agricultural products to India.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Blackstone exits Mindspace REIT, sells stake for ₹1,740 cr: Report
text: US private equity firm Blackstone has completely exited Mindspace Business Parks REIT by selling its balance 9.2% stake to Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) for around ₹1,740 crore, reports said. Blackstone had acquired a 15% minority stake in the K Raheja Corp portfolio in March 2017 and sold stake worth $100 million in the company's IPO in 2020.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: I-T detects ₹800 cr hidden cash transactions after raids in Andhra, Telangana
text: Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted cash transactions of ₹800 crore after it raided three real estate groups in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) said. CBDT claimed that the groups had been accepting cash in addition to the registered value of properties. The Department raided over two dozen premises linked to the realty groups.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: London Metal Exchange trading resumes after 5-hour outage
text: London Metal Exchange, which sets global prices for commodities like copper and aluminium, resumed trading on Tuesday after an outage of more than five hours. The outage occurred due to connectivity issues at a third-party data centre, LME said. The exchange has migrated all systems to its backup data and trading is proceeding as normal, LME spokesperson Miriam Heywood said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Flying was like relaxing on wicker chair: Mahindra on pic of old UK flight interior
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted a picture from 1936, showing the interior of a commercial plane of Imperial Airways, which he said was the first British commercial airline. "In these times of anxiety-ridden air travel, a refreshing throwback to when flying was like relaxing on a wicker easy chair," said Mahindra on the picture.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Meta leases half of Austin's tallest skyscraper set to open in 2023
text: Facebook's parent company Meta has leased half of what will be Austin's tallest skyscraper, Bloomberg confirmed. The company is leasing 5,89,000 square feet across 33 floors, which accounts for the entire commercial half of the 66-storey tower, a company spokesperson said. The tower, known as Sixth and Guadalupe, is currently under construction and is scheduled to open in 2023.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tim Cook earned 1,447 times the average Apple employee in 2021
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook's $98.7 million compensation in 2021 was 1,447 times that of the average employee at the company. Apple said the annual compensation of the median employee was $68,254 in 2021. The 61-year-old executive's compensation rose 570% compared with $14.8 million in 2020. While Cook's salary remained at $3 million, he received $82.3 million in stock awards.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Traffic jam inside Musk's 'Vegas Loop' built to ease congestion, user shares video
text: A video showing a traffic jam inside an underground tunnel in the US built by Elon Musk's The Boring Company was shared on Reddit. The video was allegedly filmed inside the Las Vegas Convention Centre Loop that was built for easing traffic congestion. Reacting to it, a Reddit user said, "I was told it (traffic jam inside tunnel) was impossible."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: IndiGo to cancel 20% flights as COVID-19 cases surge
text: IndiGo is cancelling 20% of its flights because of the surge in COVID-19 cases driven by the Omicron variant. It's waiving change fees and is offering free changes for all new and existing bookings made up to January 31, for flights up to March 31, 2022. Where possible, cancellation of flights will be done at least 72 hours in advance.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No breach or violation by us: Kotak Group on BharatPe MD's legal notice
text: The Kotak Group confirmed receiving a legal notice from BharatPe's MD Ashneer Grover and his wife on October 30, 2021. "We would like to confirm that there is no breach or violation by the Kotak Group in any manner whatsoever," Kotak's statement read. Grover has accused the bank of failing to secure financing and allocation of shares in Nykaa's IPO.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm shares fall to record low after Macquarie retains 'underperform' rating
text: Paytm’s parent company One97 Communications’ shares fell to a record low on Monday after financial services provider Macquarie retained its 'underperform' rating on the stock. Macquarie cut its target price to ₹900 apiece. Paytm stock, which made its market debut nearly two months ago at ₹1,955 apiece, was trading below ₹1,200 apiece on Monday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Inappropriate language used by BharatPe MD, legal action being pursued: Kotak
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank confirmed receiving a legal notice from BharatPe's MD Ashneer Grover and his wife Madhuri Grover in October. "The notice was replied to appropriately at the time, including placing on record our objections to inappropriate language used by Mr. Grover," Kotak said. Grover accused the bank of failing to secure financing and allocation of shares in Nykaa's IPO.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: BharatPe's Ashneer sent notice to Kotak for missing Nykaa IPO share allocation
text: BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover and his wife sent a legal notice to Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak and top bank executives on October 30, Moneycontrol confirmed. They accused the bank of failing to secure financing and allocation of shares in Nykaa's IPO. The news comes after an audio clip suggested Grover abused a Kotak employee, which Grover termed "fake".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Anand Mahindra retweets pic of Indian road with 70 continuous hairpin bends
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra retweeted a picture of the Kolli Hills road with 70 continuous hairpin bends in Tamil Nadu, which was originally shared by former Norwegian diplomat Erik Solheim. Mahindra wrote, "Erik you keep showing me how little I know about my own country! This is just phenomenal. I want to find out who built this road."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Jhunjhunwala's new 14-storey mansion to have football court, banquet hall: Report
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala and his family will soon move to their 14-storey mansion in Mumbai that will have a banquet hall on one floor, swimming pool on one, gym on one and a theatre on one floor, TOI reported. There are plans to build a football court on the ground floor. The 12th floor will be the master floor.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Twitter user asks Anand Mahindra if he's Punjabi, billionaire replies, 'I'm an Indian'
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra responded to a Twitter user who asked, "I know it's a stupid question to ask but then let me be stupid aap Punjabi hai Sir?" Mahindra replied, "Not a stupid question but my straight answer is that I'm an Indian." "Phenomenal mindset! Reminded me of that scene from chak de India," a user reacted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: CSB Bank's MD & CEO Rajendran to retire early on health grounds
text: CSB Bank on Saturday said C VR Rajendran will step down from his role of Managing Director (MD) and CEO on March 31, 2022, after over five years. He has decided to take an early retirement to take care of his health under the advice of his physicians, the bank said. Rajendran's term was scheduled to end in December 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance to buy control of 5-star hotel in New York in a $98 million deal
text: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industrial Investments and Holdings Limited (RIIHL) is buying a luxury 5-star hotel in New York's Manhattan in a $98.15 million deal. RIIHL will buy Columbus Centre Corporation, the indirect owner of a 73.37% stake in Mandarin Oriental, New York. RIIHL would acquire the remaining 26.63% stake if other owners of the hotel participate in the sale transaction.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ex-IAS officer to pen Tata's biography, publishing deal reportedly sealed for ₹2 crore
text: Retired IAS officer Thomas Mathew will pen the authorised biography of Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata. HarperCollins won the publishing rights for the book - 'Ratan N. Tata: The Authorized Biography' - in a reported ₹2 crore deal. "Mathew's comprehensive account of Tata's life includes unknown details and fascinating stories from his formative years," HarperCollins India said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amazon cuts paid COVID-19 leave time for US workers to 40 hours
text: Amazon workers in US who test COVID-19 positive or have to quarantine after exposure to virus will be eligible for up to 40 hours of paid leave, instead of 10 days. Further, employees can come to work after isolating for a week after testing COVID-19 positive, Amazon said. The policy change comes after the US CDC updated its health guidance.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: UPI is operational now: NPCI after users report issues with transactions
text: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) on Sunday tweeted that Unified Payments Interface (UPI) was operational after facing an "intermittent technical glitch". Earlier, several users took to Twitter to report they were unable to make transactions using digital wallets and online payment platforms. "Regret the inconvenience to UPI users...we are monitoring system closely," the NPCI said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Airbnb questioned by US lawmakers over business in China's Xinjiang
text: Two US lawmakers have raised concerns about home rental firm Airbnb's business activities in Xinjiang region, where China is accused of committing genocide against Uighur Muslims. The lawmakers cited an Axios report stating that Airbnb hosts homes in the region on land owned by an organisation sanctioned by US. Recently, Tesla was criticised after it opened a showroom in Xinjiang.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Pine Labs files for US IPO seeking to raise $500 million: Report
text: Merchant commerce platform Pine Labs has confidentially filed for an initial public offering (IPO) with the US Securities and Exchange Commission, Bloomberg reported. It is seeking to raise about $500 million and the listing could value the startup at $5.5 billion to $7 billion, the report said. Pine Labs is reportedly planning to list in the first half of 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: S Korea's SsangYong Motor sold for $254.6 million to local consortium
text: A consortium led by South Korean electric automaker Edison Motors has agreed to acquire SsangYong Motor for 305 billion won ($254.65 million), the latter said on Monday. This comes after SsangYong's sales fell to 84,496 units in 2021, about 21% lesser than its 2020 sales, as per a regulatory filing. Indian automaker Mahindra also owns about 75% stake in SsangYong.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Haven't asked RBI to reconsider joint venture with BharatPe: Centrum
text: Centrum Group has denied speculations suggesting the company has asked the RBI to reconsider its joint venture for Unity Small Finance Bank with BharatPe. The clarification comes amid allegations that BharatPe's Co-founder and MD Ashneer Grover abused an employee of Kotak Mahindra Bank. The RBI had issued a small finance bank (SFB) licence to the Centrum Group-BharatPe consortium last year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon challenges CCI's suspension of Future Coupons deal: Report
text: Amazon has filed an appeal against the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) decision to suspend its 2019 deal with Future Coupons at the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal, reported Reuters. Separately, Amazon has reportedly filed a challenge in Supreme Court against Delhi High Court's decision to stay arbitration proceedings between Future Group and Amazon in Singapore until February 1.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Total employment in 9 sectors reached 3.1 crore in July-Sept 2021: Govt
text: Labour Ministry's Quarterly Employment Survey said that total employment in nine select sectors reached 3.1 crore in the July-September quarter. This is 2 lakh more than that of the April-June quarter, when employment in these sectors was 3.08 crore. These nine sectors are Manufacturing, Construction, Trade, Transport, Education, Health, Accommodation and Restaurant, IT/ BPO, Financial Services.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Urjit Patel appointed VP of Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank
text: Former RBI Governor Urjit Patel has been appointed as the Vice President of the Beijing-based Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB). He will be replacing DJ Pandian, who has been VP and Chief Investment Officer of the Bank since its formation in 2016. Currently headed by China's Jin Liqun, AIIB currently has five vice-presidents.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: COVID-19 curbs caused 45% loss in business in 2022's first week: CAIT
text: MSMEs and other traders faced a 45% average loss in business in 2022's first week due to COVID-19 curbs imposed by states, Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) said. It added that panic among people, capital crunch and restrictions imposed without consultation were main reasons for loss in business. CAIT cited its survey conducted across 36 cities for the results.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Deposits in Jan Dhan accounts cross ₹1.5 lakh crore: Finance Ministry
text: Deposits in bank accounts opened under the Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) crossed the ₹1.5 lakh crore mark in December-end last year, as per latest finance ministry data. Of the total 44.23 crore Jan Dhan accounts, 34.9 crore are with public sector banks, 8.05 crore with regional rural banks, and the rest 1.28 crore with private sector banks.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ICAI asks CBDT to waive penalty on late filing of tax audit reports
text: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has requested the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) to waive penalty on late filing of tax audit reports and other reports or certificates for AY 2021-22 till March 31, 2022. The ICAI cited the surge in COVID-19 cases and consistent technical glitches in new I-T portal as reasons for seeking waiver.
author: Hiral Goyal
